loans.name: Sabahi

texts.en:
Sabahi is 30 years old. She is married with 5 children, aged between 15 and 1. She also takes care of 3 other people, ages 24, 28, and 30. She has run her own grocery since 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Sabahi is now looking for a loan to buy more grocery items to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to improve her business

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima has been selling udi in Zanzibar for one year. Udi is an object that Muslims burn for religious purposes and that produces a fragrance, much like incense. Halima sells udi both retail and wholesale. Because Zanzibar is nearly 100 percent Muslim, this is a successful business for Halima. She is hoping to take out this loan to expand her inventory and increase her profit. She is currently able to earn approximately $85 each month.

Halima is 36 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 14, and 17. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Nadharia, Mayasa, Mwatumu, and Asha.

loans.use: To buy udi

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Wiracocha Village Bank. Wiracocha means “Sun God” in Quechua. She is 50 years old and married with two children. She and her husband buy and sell products from the jungle like peanuts, sesame seeds, annatto and palillo (a condiment). Justina has a small store in Ayacucho and another in a rented space in the city of Hatun Rumi. Her husband travels to the jungle to buy these products. After cleaning and storing her products, Justina sends them to the city of Lima, and she also sells the products in the city of Ayacucho.

Justina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy peanuts and sesame seeds. Justina dreams of opening a processing plant to add value to the products she sells and dreams that her children will finish their studies and grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua. Justina es casada, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Justina junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de productos de la selva como ajonjolí, maní, achiote y palillo, Justina tiene un almacén en la ciudad de Ayacucho y en la ciudad de Hatun Rumi el cual es alquilado, Su esposo viaja a la selva para poder comprar de los productores luego de almacenar y limpiar los productos los envía a la ciudad de Lima y Justina se dedica a la venta en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Justina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maní y ajonjolí. Justina sueña con tener una empresa de transformación y darle valor agregado a los productos que comercia y que su hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Justina would like to buy peanuts and sesame seeds to sell.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Hello from Aline U. in Kigali town in Rwanda! This entrepreneur is 31 years old, married with four children. Aline started her business when she was 14 years old, selling avocados and fruits like oranges, passion fruit, lemons, etc., carrying the basket on her head.

This entrepreneur has seen her business grow over the past years and she is now selling food items. She buys beans, rice, and sorghum in tons (many kilograms) and keeps them in her warehouse where she sells them at an increased price when they are in short supply and during the planting season. Besides the business, she also plants beans for both home consumption and for sale.

She is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Frws to increase her food stocks and be able to make money to pay for her children’s school fees next year; they study in secondary schools. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her stock of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Ol Bin Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fourteen people from the Phum Saeprammuoy Village in the Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Sam Ol B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Kung Samut, is a construction worker who generates little income to support the famiL.. Mrs. Sam Ol B. is 28 years old and the mother of three children who are all construction workers. Although these famiL. members try to work hard, they still cannot support the famiL. well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sam Ol B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business, and she also hopes to increase her income in order to provide a better life for her famiL..

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Tanto el padre como la madre de  María eran comerciantes, así que ella se crió en un ambiente de  negocio. Ha trabajado toda su vida, primero con sus padres, y luego mientras estudiaba contabilidad dedicándose a la vez de cuidar al bebé de un senador. Seguidamente se dedicó por unos ocho años a la venta de chompas, bordados, y productos de macramé producidos por ella misma, y hoy en día esto es todavía parte de sus negocios.

Tras casarse, María trabajó junto a su esposo vendiendo papa rellena (plato típico peruano) por las calles, y cuando él expresó el deseo de estudiar mecánica ahorraron juntos para contratar un profesor que le enseñara el negocio. Después de unos años sacaron un préstamo para que su esposo pudiera empezar su propio negocio de mecánica. 

Por otro lado, María continuó en sus negocios independientes. En casi trece años de matrimonio sus negocios han sido variados, trabajando en todo lo relacionado con  macramé (zapatos, carteras), hasta vender papa rellena por las calles.

Desde hace tres años ha estado trabajando en su actual negocio - la crianza de pollos y cuyes para venderlos cocinados de acuerdo a los pedidos. Además, se dedica a la venta de ropa y tejidos que va ofreciendo a tiendas en Lima y a sus amistades. Con su esposo ahorran las ganancias de sus negocios para mejorar poco a poco su hogar y el nivel de vida de toda la familia.

Está muy feliz de las oportunidades que le dan los préstamos, ya que le permiten acercarse a su objetivo: un futuro mejor para sus tres hijos de once, siete y dos años.
texts.en:
Both Maria’s mother and father worked in sales, so she grew up in a business environment. She has always worked, first with her parents, then, while studying accounting she worked as a babysitter for a senator’s baby. After that she worked for 8 years selling sweaters, embroidery and macramé products that she made herself. Today this still makes up part of her business. After she got married, Maria worked with her husband as a street vendor selling a typical Peruvian food called papa rellena (mashed potatoes stuffed with ground meat). When her husband expressed his desire to study to become a mechanic, they saved their money to pay for a teacher. A few years later they took out a loan so her husband could start his own business as a mechanic. Maria continued with her own business. In almost 13 years of marriage she has had a variety of jobs, working with everything related to macramé (shoes, wallets), and selling food on the street. For the past 13 years she has also worked in her current business—raising chickens and guinea pigs to sell cooked-to-order. She also sells clothing and textiles that she offers to stores in Lima and to her friends. Maria and her husband save the money they earn from their businesses to slowly improve their home and their quality of life. She is very happy with the opportunities these loans have given her because they allow her to work towards her goal: a better future for her children, who are 11, 7, and 2.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for her animals

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 47-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. BilA. has owned a grocery store for fifteen years. He also sells vegetables. BilA. requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that BilA. has requested a loan.

His clients are people from his area. BilA. decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita G. is a 55-year-old married mother of five.  Three of her children have finished school, and her youngest daughter attends college.  Her husband is a laborer.  Lucita plans to use the money from this loan to buy inventory for her "sari sari" shop.  "Sari sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds," and these shops sell an array of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities.  The stores are usually operated out of the owner's home, are neighborhood watering holes, and retail in small units—selling single cigarettes, for example.  Sari sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in rural areas.  Lucita learned the sari sari trade from her mother, and had a store before that was destroyed by a typhoon. She hopes to fully rebuild and expand her operation, and use her income to support her children and grandchildren's education.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a small general store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is fifty six years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are currently in senior high school. The other is out of school and working. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. 

Mary works to support her husband financially. She is a trader in cosmetics. She procures cosmetics such as body sprays, powder, creams, etc. She hawks to sell her products in her community. Mary also treks to other markets to sell on the market days. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure varieties of cosmetics in bulk. Mary is hopeful that she can help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure cosmetics

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 35 years old and living in the village of Cabisera 5, Centro, San Isidro, Isabela. She and her partner are not yet married but they have been together for more than 20 years and he is the father of their two children. Their son Dan is 18 years old and a high school undergraduate while their youngest is a high school student.

Juvelyn is a fish, meat, and chicken vendor in her village. She uses their tricycle as transportation in selling her products inside and outside of the village. For the continuous growth of her business, she is now requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 as business capital. She wants to satisfy her customers' needs. She believes that through her business she can continue to send them to school even for a two year course.

She strives hard to make her business grow and generate more income. She knows successful people keep moving forward and she always keeps herself motivated.

loans.use: To invest in her business selling meat, chicken, and fish.

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan baji is a very modest lady. She believes in hard work. Her husband handles a livestock business. He sells buffaloes to customers. Hamidan baji helps him by taking care of the buffaloes.

Hamidan baji is a 53-years-old married lady and a citizen of the city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Kot Radha Kishan is famous for its sweetmeats and for its festivals. Hamidan baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to complete customer's orders and to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Venibeb

texts.en:
"I started farming when I was a small kid. My father taught me everything from sowing the seeds to harvesting the grains. I learned also some techniques to achieve better yield in my crops. Now, that I am married to a farmer, I work my very best to help him in the farm and provide all their needs", says Venibeb B., 32-year old mother of two children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate. The loan will really help him improve his harvest and his income for the family as well.

Through CEVI, he is able to sustain his livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients not just loans. They also include training and insurance coverage as part of their services.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Abraikul

texts.ru: Абрайкул Раджабов проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абрайкул 10 лет работал по специальностью, трактористом. Теперь как 10 лет занимается земледелием, т.е. выращивает бахчевые растения и рис. Клиент просит кредит, чобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горючее для посева рисовых плантаций.
texts.en:
Abraikul R. lives in the Rumy region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Abraikul worked for 10 years in his profession as a tractor driver. For 10 years he has been working in agriculture, growing melons and rice. The client is asking for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer and fuel to plant rice plantations.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace started her fish sales two years ago at Sefwi where she lives. She is now 30 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school.

Grace prepares her goods and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish. Because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She takes delivery of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region and wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales. That will produce increased income to support her children’s education and her business growth.

She would be grateful for your assistance. It is her dream to save more to build her own house so that her children would not grow to suffer that much.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
“Margaritas” es un grupo de  trece señoras  y pertenecen al Centro Focal “German Busch”, todas tienen  negocios pequeños como la venta de juguetes, otras cuentan con un taxi conjuntamente con su esposo y requieren el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento a su movilidad y la mayoría se dedica al   tejido de alfombras  y  mantas, por ejemplo Maria Antonia C. de 34 años de edad, confecciona alfombras  hace 10 años, creando siempre nuevos diseños y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la lana. 

Su presidenta es Maritza S., cuenta que “Margaritas” es un grupo muy unido y son solidarias entre ellas.
texts.en:
Margaritas is a group of thirteen women and part of the German Busch "centro focal". All of the women own small businesses selling merchandise such as toys. Others operate taxi businesses with their husbands and need loans to maintain their vehicles. Most of them, though, work at making and selling woven textiles such as rugs and blankets. For example, Maria Antonia C., 34, has been making rugs for 10 years, always creating new designs. She needs a loan to buy wool and other raw materials.

The president of the group, Maritza S., says that Margaritas is a close-knit group whose members look out for one another.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and services for a range of businesses.

loans.name: Mukama Talemwa Nagobi Rebecca Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca is twenty three years old and is married with two children. She has operated a spare-parts shop for over five years. She is using the loan to buy shop items – that is, spare parts for bicycles – in much more volume.

Being so encouraged, Rebecca’s future hope is to enlarge her business and obtain another shop aside from the one that sells spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for bicycles in much more volume

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 29 years old and is married with two children.  She and her husband work together making and selling charcoal.  They live in the city of Pucallpa. 

Doris has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a year and belongs to the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage).  She plans to invest this loan of 1000 soles in purchasing wood to make charcoal.  

Doris and her husband have large ovens for making charcoal 40 kilometers outside of Pucallpa, along the highway which links the city to the capital, Lima.  Doris has been investing in her charcoal business since she first began taking out loans from Manuela Ramos.  As a result, her business has grown and she and her husband now employ several people to help make their charcoal.  

Doris’s goal is to increase her production of charcoal in order to be able to sell in other cities.

loans.use: Wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells crates of drinks in wholesale and retail. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. Bola is 43 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 46 años, es un hombre muy alegre y tranquilo, vive en la casa de su madre, a quien desea dar una vejez tranquila. El trabajo al que Humberto se dedica es la confección y venta de zapatos, él tiene una pequeña empresa junto a su madre, en la cual trabaja muy duro para sacarla adelante. Paralelamente, también trabaja vendiendo los zapatos que confecciona, si bien distribuye la mayoría de zapatos a otras tiendas, guarda los más bonitos para venderlos él mismo. Lo que más le gusta a Humberto de su trabajo es diseñar los nuevos modelos que sacará al mercado, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los zapatos hasta los lugares donde los distribuye, ya que son muy pesados. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda poner una marca comercial propia a sus zapatos. Humberto se encuentra en su tercer préstamo con MFP y tiene el firme compromiso de no fallar en sus pagos y de ser responsable con el resto de las socias de su banco comunal. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para elaborar nuevos zapatos.
texts.en:
Humberto is 46 years old; he is a very happy and calm man. He lives in his mother's house, and he hopes to provide her with security and peace in her old age. Humberto does tailoring and sells shoes; he and his mother own a small business, where he works hard to get ahead. At the same time, he works selling shoes that he has made. He distribues most of the shoes to other stores, but keeps the best pairs to sell in his store. What Humberto likes the most about his work is designing new types of shoes to sell in the market. He has done this work for 15 years and thinks the most difficult part is transporting the shoes to vendors, because the shoes are very heavy. In the future he hopes to see his business grow so that he can sell his shoes under his own brand name. Humberto is on his third loan with MFP and is firmly committed to making his payments and being a responsible member of his community bank. With the 9,000 PEN he is requesting, he will buy better quality materials to produce new shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Fernando Martín

texts.es:
A la vivienda el señor Fernando Martín G. le está haciendo falta la impermeabilización en el techo de la casa ya que está en muy mal condiciones y cuando llueve se le mojan los muebles de su casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder impermeabilizar el techo de su casa ya que tiene tres hijos pequeños y se le han estado enfermando por la humedad que hay en la casa.
El señor Fernando trabaja en una empresa donde se filma eventos sociales, en el departamento de administrador de videos, este es el ingreso que el genera para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
Cuando fuimos a realizar la visita a la casa del señor Fernando se encontraba en su trabaja y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Rosa Isela Garza, quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Fernando Martín G. is lacking a waterproof roof because the current one is in poor condition. The furniture inside of his house gets wet whenever it rains.

He is requesting a loan to waterproof the roof because he has three small children who have gotten sick because of the moisture that has seeped into the house. Sr. Fernando works in the video department of a company that films special events. Part of the income that he earns will be used to repay the loan.

When we visited Sr. Fernando’s home, he was not able to meet with us because he was at work. His wife, Sra. Rosa Isela Garza, is the person who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof the roof of his house

loans.name: Juan Moisés

texts.es: Juan Moisés O. C. reside en el departamento de San Salvador. A sus 40 años de edad Juan es padre soltero de cuatro niños de 15,12, 7 y 5 años de edad. Juan ha sacado adelante a sus hijos con mucha organización y sacrificios en su día a día, para generar ingresos para su familia, Juan se dedica a la confección de ropa la que luego es comercializada de manera ambulante por él, ahora Juan solita de un crédito para mejorar sus ingresos al igual que su calidad de vida a través del mejoramiento de ganancias por sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juan Moisés O. C. lives in the department of San Salvador. He is a 40 year old single father of four children (ages 15, 12, 7, and 5). Juan has managed get ahead for the sake of children by being organized and making daily sacrifices. In order to generate an income for his family, Juan produces clothing and then sells them as a street vendor. He is now requesting a loan so that he can increase his sales, thereby improving his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
La socia EVARISTA pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 58 años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos (dos varones y tres mujeres), ellos son casados y alternan sus actividades con el hogar y con el trabajo, cada uno de los hijos tienen su propia familia. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas.   

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de venta de comida. Ella prepara comida  para la hora del desayuno , almuerzo y cena,todos los días en su local. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de comida quiere compran mas insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, etc., para preparar más comida.          
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Evarista is a member of the "Minibank" communal bank and is a native of the city of Cuzco. She is 58 years old, married and has five children (two male and three female). They are married and alternate between home and work activities. Each one of her children has his or her own family. Evarista maintains a small business selling food. She balances home activities with the job of selling food. Everyday, she prepares food for breakfast, lunch and dinner in her area. She is requesting the loan in order to increase the amount of food she can produce for sale. She wants to buy more supplies, such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, etc. in order to prepare more food. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium and thus is committed to complying with the payment timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en:
Mr. Chhea A., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Sun Leng, 45, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They  married in 1980 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married and live in their own homes; the others are in school. 


Chhea and his wife have been growing rice for 29 years. They have also started a new business raising pigs. Chhea is requesting his second loan of $1,000 to buy more piglets to raise and to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una socia emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali.
Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es conductor de motocar. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes que funciona en su casa donde vende al por menor.
Miriam es socia nueva y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” y necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizarà para comprar productos de primera necesidad. 
La meta de Miriam es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes bien implementada para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miriam is a hardworking member, who lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 37 years old, is the mother of two young children, and counts on the support of her husband, who is a driver. She has a grocery store that she runs out of her house where she sells retail. Miriam is a new member and is part of the Las Fresitas ("the strawberries") Community Bank. She needs a credit of $125 which she will use to buy necessities. Miriam's goal is to have a well-established grocery store to better serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of necessities

loans.name: Edma Clarisa

texts.es: Edma tiene 86 años, no es el primer financiamiento que solicito a Fundación León 2000 le han sido de muy buena ayuda por lo que han sido para la inversión de su negocio. Por lo que logro pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma, la actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general ella tiene muchos clientes por lo que esta temporada del año tiene los encargos suficientes y ella está muy alegre  por lo ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, calzado, sobre cama, vestidos entre otros productos. Su deseo es seguir con este negocio, que le ha brindado lo necesario para el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Edma, 86, has had prior loans with Fundación León 2000 that have been very helpful to her as investments in her business. She was able to repay them in a timely fashion. Her commercial activity is the sale of general merchandise. She has many customers so this time of year has sufficient orders. She is very cheerful and she enjoys chatting with her customers. She needs financing in order to buy purses, footwear, bedspreads, dresses, among other things. Her wish is to continue with her work, which has provided her with income to cover her basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy purses, footwear, bedspreads, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and in the rice-farming business in Norala, South Cotabato. She started her business back in 2005. She also raises ducks as another source of income. With the income she receives from her farm, the financial needs of her family are met.  

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, to take a loan for her farm. She requested the amount of 12,000 Philippine pesos as additional capital to finance her business. With this amount, she can buy fertilizers and feed for her ducks.

loans.use: Fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Bou's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bou S. lives in Prey Chheu village, Takeo province and is representing a group of four people. This group loan will be used to purchase more materials, supplies and other items that will help to improve the lifestyle of the group members and their families.

Mrs. Bou S. is a silk weaver. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it through a loan to buy more silks.

Mrs. Bou S. is 41 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is artist, while another supports her in her business while the youngest is 13 years old. Her husband, ChroE. Nut is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice in order to earn a small income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy more silks

loans.name: Estela Claribel

texts.es: Estela Claribel de 40 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 15 y el menor de 12, los cuales estudian. Estela esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, pues necesita reparar el piso y una pared de su casa que se encuentran en mal estado, ademas, si el dinero alcanza desea comprar una puerta y ventanas de su casa para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida quien trabaja como albañil, quien le hara los trabajos que desea.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener su casa bonita con las condiciones necesarias para que su familia viva bien.  Espera contar con el apoyo de AFODENIC y KIVA para realizar este proyecto.
texts.en:
Estela is a 40 year old single mother. Her sons are aged 15 and 12 and attend school. She is requesting her third loan so that she can make improvements to her home. The floor and one wall are in need of repair. If there is enough money left over, she would like to buy a new door and windows so that her family can be more secure. She has the support of her domestic partner who works as a mason and who will do the work for her. She dreams of having a nice home so that her family can live well. She hopes to get support from AFODENIC and KIVA to be able to complete this project.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building supplies

loans.name: Leny

texts.en: Leny S. is a married women who supports her family with her general store, furniture business and rice retailing business. She lives in Barangay Cubay, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their two schooled children who are 13 and 16 years old. Leny has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, furniture, and rice businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 9,000. Leny is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can continue to be able to purchase additional inventory for her general store and her rice business. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 18,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Leny aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Gemelita's Group

texts.en:
Gemelita G. is from the village of Buenavista. She is 40 years old. Gemelita is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gemelita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemelita sells dried foods in the local community. Gemelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Gemelita joined PMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemelita successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Gemelita is requesting her sixth loan from PMPC, for 7000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed for her products. She will use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for products to sell.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra runs a fishpond. She is 44 years old, married with three children. Her oldest child is now aged 22. Like other mothers, she wants to give them a proper education and a bright future. She thanks God for her fishpond because it helps provide for the increasing needs in her household. It is also a big help in sustaining her children’s education.

Isidra grows milkfish in her pond. She sells them to people in her community and sometimes at the market. She applied for a loan of 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more milkfish and fish food so her fish will grow.

loans.use: To buy milkfish and fish food

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old, married and has one child who goes to school. He runs a retail shop in his home area. He has been in this business for six years now. He also practices farming to earn enough money to support his family. He has been saving part of his profits with his group in Faulu Kenya called Nuru Investments, which guarantees loans to its members. He has high hopes of improving his business and his living conditions as a result of being able to access loans. 

He has requested a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of sugar, rice, cooking fat and cereals to his shop.  He dreams of growing his business to wholesale and of offering a better education for his children in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar, rice, cooking fat and cereals

loans.name: Jaylen

texts.en:
Jaylen A. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old. Jaylen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jaylen owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Jaylen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jaylen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jaylen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jaylen is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Jaylen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila M., from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur, is 41 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, for four years Laila has owned and operated a specialized retail store selling rice and corn grains in the local community. She also sells these commodities wholesale, earning approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Laila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 11,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. Laila plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto H. O. de 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante de productos varios, así mismo vive junto a sus dos nietas de 9 y 13 años de edad, quienes se encuentran al cuidado de Jorge y de su esposa. Jorge se dedica a transportar niños a los cuales lleva de sus casas al colegio y viceversa, ya que él posee un microbus gracias al cual desde hace siete años inició su negocio de transporte escolar. Él es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo el cual se mantiene en contacto frecuente a través de su teléfono celular con los padres de los niños que transporta y así mismo con los maestros de los colegios, ya que no solo se encarga de llevar a los estudiantes sino también de informar a los padres de los eventos y reuniones de los centros escolares, así mismo esta es una de las formas más seguras para contactarlo de forma directa cuando alguien quiere contratar sus servicios. Jorge solicita un préstamo a Integral, para poder comprar algunos repuestos a su vehiculo, así mismo para poder brindarle todo el mantenimiento necesario, todo esto con el deseo de brindar un servicio seguro a los niños en donde se puedan transportar de una forma eficiente, en la cual sus padres cuenten con la confianza que sus hijos se encuentran en buenas manos.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto H. O., 62, lives with his wife who works as a merchant of various products. They live with their two granddaughters, 9 and 13, who are in Jorge and his wife's care. Jorge owns a minibus and started his school transportation business seven years ago. He transports children from their houses to school and back. He is very dedicated to his work and maintains frequent contact via cellphone with the parents of the children he transports, and with the schoolteachers, since he is not only responsible for transporting students but also for informing parents of school events and meetings. The cellphone is also one of the most secure ways to contact him directly when someone wants to hire his services. Jorge is requesting a loan from Integral to buy some spare parts for his vehicle, and to provide all necessary maintenance to his vehicle. This is all to offer a safe service to the children, where they can be transported efficiently and parents can have confidence that their children are in good hands.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts for school minibus

loans.name: Jean-Claude

texts.fr:
Il est dans la vente  des cartes téléphonique, marié,il est père de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 21ans et 16ans né au Congo à Brazzaville, avec un niveau d'étude sécondaire, il est dans la vente des cartes et appels Téléphoniques depuis 5ans.
En améliorant sa cabine, il va attire plus de clients en: achetant un para-pluies ou para-soleil, en peignant sa cabine avec des couleurs vivent, il va faireplus dev bénéfices.
le prêt va lui permettre de réaliser ses projets comme  rélancer son activité prémière qui la ménuisérie, car ses recettes journaliere son comprises entre 20000f et 35000f.
En ayant comme vision d'être compter parmis les leaders de votre institution,il va ajouter d'autres cabines pour atteindre son but.
il veut que ses enfants évoluent dans les études et initier son fils au métir de ménuisérie.Il est l'écoute surtout des vieux de son quartier.
texts.en:
This is a man who sells phone cards.  He is married and the father of two children, aged 16 and 21.  He was born in the Congo in Brazzaville and has a middle school education.  He has been selling phone cards and phone calls for five years.  By improving his phone booth, he is going to attract more customers by buying an umbrella or parasol and by painting his booth with bright colors.  He is going to make more profit.  The loan will enable him to realize his plans, such as revitalizing his first business, carpentry, because his daily receipts amount to 20,000 to 35,000 francs. Envisioning being a recognized leader of your institution, he will add more phone booths to achieve his goal.  He wants his children to advance in their studies and his son to be introduced to the carpentry trade.  He is especially attentive to the elderly in his district. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving the phone booth and buying phone cards

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen S. is currently in the business of selling bags of simsim and groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of millet and dried cassava to sell. Hellen is 33 years old and married to a farm laborer. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a store for her goods.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of millet and dried cassava to sell

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina B. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 34 years old. Rizalina is single and has a 1-year-old child. To make a living, Rizalina runs a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Rizalina has been engaged in her business for over six years. Rizalina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients, like sugar and flour. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rizalina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients, like sugar and flour

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N. sells fresh and frozen fish and meat at Takoradi.  Esther has junior high educational background.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a miner. 

Esther has been selling fresh fish and meat for some time now. She helps her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish for sale. She hopes to plough back her profit into her business.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Abby

texts.en: Abby N. is fifty eight years old, widowed and has five children aged between thirty four years old and twenty two years old. She does her business in the Donholm estate in Nairobi. She builds rental houses. She has been in this business for two years now. She says that this business is profitable and she hopes to increase the size of her business  and earn more income. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to increase her capital as she continues  building. She hopes to build more houses and become a well known landlady. She describes herself as an aggressive and ambitious business person.

loans.use: Rental house construction.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel J. is from the village of San Vicente. He is 22 years old. Ruel is single. To make a living, Ruel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ruel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruel is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This is Ruel's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Diana Janneth

texts.es: Diana C. de 37 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 1, 7 y 10 años; ella tiene un negocio de confección de ropa deportiva para adultos, con el que sueña verlo crecer como una gran empresa. Desde el año 2006 estudió diseño, corte y confección de ropa en un instituto técnico y en el año 2008, después de estudiar su idea,  emprendió su negocio, comprando una máquina familiar e iniciando sus labores en  su pequeño apartamento. Con su trabajo disciplinado y responsable, poco a poco fue aumentando su capital hasta llegar a tener 5 maquinas semiindustriales y ganar el mercado de su barrio, teniendo en cuenta que tiene una gran competencia de talleres que allí realizan sus operaciones. En la actualidad está solicitando su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que se acercó estimulada por su oferta de servicios, pues quiere adicionar una maquina industrial, para mejorar su proceso de acabado y los tiempos de producción. Su sueño es ampliar el  taller, buscando una oferta de productos que llame la atención de clientes potenciales, ubicados en otras zonas de la localidad a los cuales aun no ha llegado. Su principal desafío fue ganar el mercado del sector, pues está rodeada de tres talleres y está ubicada frente a un importante  centro comercial , donde hay buenas vías de acceso y es un  punto estratégico  para el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: Diana C. is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children of the following ages: 1, 7, and 10 years old.  She makes adult sports clothes, which she hopes to watch grow into a large company.  Since 2006, she studied design, cut, and tailoring at a technical college.  In 2008, after investigating her idea, she started her own business, purchasing a domestic sewing machine and beginning her work in her tiny apartment.  With discipline and responsibility, her capital began increasing little by little until she owned 5 semi-industrial sewing machines and dominated her neighborhood's market, keeping in mind that there is a lot of competition from other nearby workshops.  Currently, she is seeking her first financial loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that she felt encouraged to join for their available services.  She wants to add an industrial sewing machine in order to improve the finishing on her pieces and their production time.  Her dream is to expand her workshop and to offer a selection of products that capture the attention of potential clients located in other areas of her locality that have yet to know about her business.  Her main challenge has been winning her sector's market since she is surrounded by three other workshops.  Nonetheless, she is situated in front of an important shopping center, where there are accessible means of reaching her business and serve as a strategic point for its growth.

loans.use: Purchase machinery to improve the finishing touches on her pieces and their production and completion time.

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en: Selling produce is a popular small-business venture in Uganda. This is what N. Deogratias has decided to do--and where he has invested his savings--in order to earn more profit. The married father of five children started a grocery store 18 years ago in Kakasi, Ibanda. He sells primarily dry foods, especially cereals, and produce. Due to his hard work and determination, he has been able to run this business, earning 220,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. With this loan he is looking forward to restocking the business with more maize and beans. He plans on expanding his business further into wholesale; he says this will attract many customers to his shop. His main goal is to earn more revenue and expand his business so that he can support his family and educate his children.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of maize and beans

loans.name: Evandre Celio

texts.pt:
Evandre Célio Joaquim M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, pai de uma menina de 7 anos que vai a Escola. Vive na casa cedida pelo Estado e responsabiliza se pelos seus três irmãos mais novos e sua mãe que vivem com ele.

Apois a sua formação em Manhiça, volta a Namaacha como Professor onde é afeto na Escola Maria Auxiliadora, no departamento cultural da Administração Distrital de Namaacha onde tem um salário base de 4,700mt por mês. Possui também um negocio próprio de venda de refeições e produtos de primeira necessidade onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt juntamente com o salario consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria. 

Este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 9.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (bolachas, refrescos, sumos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria no seu estabelecimento comercial. Os anteriores créditos de (10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 6.000.00mt) foram usados para compra de material de construção. 

No futuro gostaria de conseguir construir um estúdio adjacente a sua casa para poder tocar com os amigos e ate gravar suas próprias músicas. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar cem nenhum problema.
texts.en:
Evandre Célio Joaquim M. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  He has a seven-year-old daughter who goes to school.  He lives in a house provided by the State and supports his three youngest siblings and his mother, who all live with him.

After completing his training in Manhiça, Evandre returned to Namaacha as a teacher, where he is employed at Maria Auxiliadora School and in the cultural department of Namaacha's District Administration.  He has a base salary of 4,700 meticais per month.  He also has his own business selling meals and staple goods, and he earns about 3,000 meticais together with his salary.  He saves some of this money in his bank account.

This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku.  He is asking for 9,000 meticais to buy products (crackers, soft drinks, juices and other items) to increase the inventory in his shop.  The previous loans of 10,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 6,000 meticais were used to buy construction materials.

In the future, Evandre would like to build a studio next to his house so he could play music with his friends and even record his own songs.  He is confident that he will pay back the loan with no problems.

loans.use: Purchase products (crackers, soft drinks, juices, etc.)

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. is 55 years old and is from the Mamboleo area in the outskirts of Kisumu city. She is married to Fredrick Ngeso and they have seven children who are all above 18 years.

Florence has a cereals business and has been doing it for the past 10 years. She has created a huge clientele through the years and has high demands from them. She is in need of maize, beans, groundnuts and rice to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to venture into a chicken rearing business in the future

loans.use: Buy maize, beans, groundnuts and rice

loans.name: 1.1.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Thuy N. T. is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of T. Hoa. Thuy is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.01.1.2 ).

Thuy is married and has two adult-aged children. To making a living, Thuy owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pork products in the local community.  Thuy has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Thuy joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thuy is requesting a loan from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women for the first time. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for saL.. This will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the other borrowers in the group:


1. L. T. T. Van (7) is a 20-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her food stall business.


2. N. T. T. Thuy (8) is a 21-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her retail store.


About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thuy N. T. (6) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố T. Hoa.  Thuy là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.01.1.2 ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ thịt heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thuy thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuy kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Thuy đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thuy đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. T. Van (7) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  N. T. T. Thuy (8) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Maria Hermandina

texts.es:
María de 43 años, se dedico a coser ropa para ayudar en los gastos familiares ya que tiene 4 hijos con su esposo de 19, 18, 13 y 11 años de edad. Ellos viven en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo. 

Desde hace un año atrás ella comenzó con su taller de costura y confección debido a que el dinero que ganaba su esposo no les alcanzaba para mantener a sus hijos.  Con una péquela máquina de coser ha venido trabajando desde hace un año. Ubico su taller en una parte que readecuo de su casa ya que por ahora no tiene dinero para ubicarla en otro lugar. Cada costura la cobra en un promedio de $ 1.00 según sea el tamaño. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y hilos para que su negocio este aumentando. En el futuro quiere tener un local propio y tener una cartera de clientes alta.
texts.en:
María, 43, went into clothes making to help with household expenses because she and her husband have four children who are 19, 18, 13 and 11 years of age.  They live in an urban zone called Guasmo.

She started her sewing workshop a year ago because her husband’s salary was insufficient to support the children.  She has been working for a year with a small sewing machine.  She set up her shop in part of her house that she equipped for this because she doesn’t have money to set it up anywhere else.  She charges on average $1.00 for each repair depending on size.  She works from 8am until 7pm every day.

She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and thread so that the business can grow.  In the future she’d like to have her own locale and a large customer base.

loans.use: For fabric and thread.

loans.name: Humberto Enrique

texts.es:
Humberto de 31 años de edad, es empleado, reside en San Miguel junto a su esposa y dos hijos, él trabaja para una empresa comercial como vendedor des hace 7 años con un horario de 7:30 am a 5:00pm, este trabajo le ha permitido llevar el alimento diario a su familia y cubrir los gastos generados en el hogar.
Él está en reconstruir su vivienda, mejorando algunas paredes dañadas pero el presupuesto no lo logra cubrir por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, piedra y hierro, materiales importantes en el proceso de reconstrucción, con este préstamo podrá solventar esta situación y llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de la vivienda.
Su objetivo es continuar trabajando por su familia, mejorar las condiciones actuales de su vivienda ofreciéndoles un hogar más bonito, ordenado y amplio.
texts.en:
Humberto, age 31, lives in San Miguel with his wife and two children. For seven years, he's been employed as a salesman for a retail company where he works from 7:30am till 5:00pm. This job has allowed him to put food on the table for his family as well as to cover various household expenses.

Humberto is renovating his home, fixing some walls that have fallen into disrepair. However, he doesn't have the sufficient funds to purchase the necessary raw materials, and for this reason he is asking for a loan that would allow him to purchase sand, stone, cement, and iron -- all the items he needs for the renovations. With the help of the loan, he will be able to complete the improvements.

His goal is to continue working for the benefit of his family and improve their living conditions, giving them a home that is more spacious, orderly, and beautiful.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  Farming and buying and selling rice. Her husband Nestor F. is 55 years old.  He works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 3 children between 26 and 32 years old.  One child has a family and the other 2 are working. 

Elisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future. Elisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its programs, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 39 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su trabajo, ella ha estudiado una carrera técnica y trabaja en una ONG cristiana. Celia requiere el préstamo y es para uso personal como por ejemplo para la alimentación de sus hijos.

Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Celia is 39 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Perú.  After completing her household activities, she works on her business.  She undertook vocational studies and works for a Christian NGO.  Celia needs the loan for personal use, such as buying food for her children, and was not able to specify exactly what the money is for.

Celia belongs to the "Renovación" communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa of Cusco, Perú.  The communal bank is made up of entrepreneurial and hard-working people who are always looking for opportunities to help their children get ahead.  Cusco is an enchanting city that goes back to the time of the Incas; the city is built on the base of the old Incan citadel.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor, 54, is married and lives with her husband, daughter and two nephews in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband is retired and receives a pension of 105,000 MNT and her daughter works as a salesperson at a bakery shop where she is paid 230,000 MNT monthly. Her two nephews attend a local secondary school. They have a decent standard of living. 

Dolgor used to operate a food shop between 2004 and 2006 before she started her current business. Since 2007, she makes handmade items for gers, Mongolian nomadic housing tents, such as ropes used like a belt to keep the ger stable. She purchases the necessary production materials from the local market and sells them back as ropes, belts and ties used for building a ger. Her monthly profit is 200,000-300,000 MNT. She wants to enlarge her workshop and expand her business. She is a hardworking and brave person who says, "I would like to enlarge my workshop and expand my business." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more material to make items for gers and, also, to enlarge her current workshop.

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito – Juli, departamento D. Puno, tiene 50 años D. edad.  Está casada y tienen 7 hijos, 5 D. ellos ya tienen familia.  Concepción solo pudo estudiar la primaria pero no la pudo terminar.
Con la participación D. su esposo se dedican a la producción D. la trucha, después D. cierto tiempo D. crecimiento y engorD., ella lleva a las ciudades D. Arequipa y Cusco para venderlos, no solo se dedica a la actividad mencionada sino también hace hermosos trabajos D. bordado.  Trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace doce años, el primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  este dinero lo invirtió en la  compra y venta  D. golosinas.
Con éste préstamo D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará  cuarenta kilos D. alimento, marca Naltech para la trucha.
 Su sueño es  salir adelante y exportar truchas para mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es conversar en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Concepción is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo" communal bank which is located in the district of Juli in the province of chucuito - Juli, in the department of Puno.  She is 50 years old, married and has 7 children, 5 of whom have their own families.  Concepción began a primary education but was unable to finish it.  

She and her husband run a trout farm.  Once the fish are big enough she travels to the cities of Arequipo and Cusco to sell them.  She also sells the beautiful hand-maD. embroidery she makes.  She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movimiento for 12 years.  Her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN was used to buy and sell sweets.

She plans to use this new 300 PEN loan to buy 40 kilograms of Naltech brand trout feed.  Her dream is to get ahead and start to export trout to improve income.  Se enjoys the conversations that take place during the meetings at the communal bank.

loans.use: To buy 40 kilograms of Naltech brand trout feed

loans.name: Argin

texts.en:
Argin D. R. is from the village of Villa Felipa, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental. She is 28 years old. Argin is married. Argin operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling used-clothing (or ukay-ukay) in the local community. Argin has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Argin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Argin is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bulk of used-clothing. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Argin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bulk used-clothing.

location.town: Villa Felipa, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a married woman who lives in Negros Oriental, Philippines. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: electronic games and a general store. Her husband Enorciso, who is 56 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living.  They have seven children who are 17 to 31 years old. Rosalinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to pay for an additional game unit and stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for a future business expansion. Rosalinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase an additional game unit and purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old and married with 10 children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, biscuits, and other grocery items to sell in her store.

Delia has borrowed and paid 18 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from farming.

Delia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her general store

loans.name: Mr. Kha Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen members make up this village bank loan. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family’s standard of living. Mr. Kha is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to support his own family and to sell. His wife, Mrs. Horn, is a recycling seller. In the rice field, he faces some problems because it is time for growing. To improve his rice production, Mr. Kha is applying for a loan to buy rice seed and pesticide, and to plow his rice field. He will use the rest of the loan to buy more recycled goods to resell. He is the father of four children: one is a farmer and the others are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pesticide, and to plow his rice field

loans.name: Marylin Esther

texts.es:
Marylin Esther O. de 46 años vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio y se dedica al comercio de ropa, calzado, perfumería, platería y cosméticos en general; ella  tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 16 años con los que sueña ver prósperos y productivos y por eso en ese tema se esmera por lograr una educación de calidad y es precisamente su mayor motivación en el trabajo que desempeña como comerciante.
Marylin inició  su negocio en el año 2008, cuando una hermana le transmitió su experiencia  y ella no dudó en aprovecharla y trabajar en la venta de mercancías variada, ahora trabaja 6 horas diarias y las combina con su labor doméstica porque necesita estar muy cerca a sus dos hijos  para atenderlos también. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, familiares, referidos y especialmente empleados de empresas, a ellos les acredita la mercancía y otorga plazos adaptados a las características de cada uno. La competencia de su mercado es aguerrida y para Marylin este es su mayor desafío, pero como maneja muy bien  sus relaciones con los proveedores, logra precios que traslada a sus clientes,  con los cuales los mantiene fieles. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará ropa calzado,  cosméticos y platería para atender la demanda que tiene en esta época de gran despliegue comercial, porque se avecina el día de las madres y sus clientes encuentran soluciones de obsequios de calidad y a buen precio en el negocio de Marilyn. Su meta más adelante es emprender un punto de ventas en un centro comercial muy reconocido y ubicado en el corazón de la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, comunidad en la habita e interactúa un mercado formal e informal, conjuntos residenciales y escenarios deportivos como el Estadio Metropolitano de Futbol, donde juegan los equipos profesionales de Colombia y es la casa del Junior de Barranquilla “el equipo del pueblo”.
texts.en:
Marylin Esther O. is 46 years old and lives in Ciudadela 20 de Julio. She works selling clothes, shoes, perfume, jewelry and cosmetics. She has 2 sons, ages 10 and 16 and dreams of seeing them productive and prosperous one day.  That is why she strives to get them a quality education, which is her primary motivation in her work. 

Marylin began her business in 2008, when one of her sisters told her about her own experience. She didn't hesitate to take the chance and began to work selling different kinds of merchandise. Now she works 6 hours a day as well as working in the home because she needs to be close to her sons and to take care of them. Her main clients are her neighbors, relatives and referrals. She offers credits to workers and offers them customized payment plans. 

Competition is fierce in her market, and it is Marylin's biggest challenge but she manages relationships with her suppliers very well and achieves good prices which she passes along to her clients, keeping them faithful. This loan is her first  from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and with it she will buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and jewelry to meet the commercial demand.  Mother's Day is approaching and her clients will find quality gifts at affordable prices in Marylin's business. 

Her next goal is to open a sales location in a well known and well located shopping center in the heart of Ciudadela 20 de Julio. The shopping center is in the town where she lives, near a residential area and sporting locations like the Metropolitan Soccer Stadium where Colombia's professional teams play and which is the home of Junior de Baranquilla, "the people's team"

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana deldistrito de Catacaos a 30 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía (metalurgia, tejido y alfarería)

Josefa es comerciante desde hace varios años de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para que pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado Josefa un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y sus alimentos y mejorar su corral donde viven sus cerdos, con la finalidad de engordarlos para luego venderlos a un mejor precio y así mejoraría la calidad de vida de su hogar.  Josefa es una mujer  muy responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener mejoras para su negocio y seguir solventando sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Josefa is the mother of a family, 46 years old, and she lives in her own home together with her husband and children. It is equipped with water and electricity and it is located in the urban district of Catacaos, 30 minutes from the department of Piura. This region is known for its agricultural, farming, and tourism activities (metal crafts, knitting, and pottery). 

For many years Josefa has been a merchant of pigs. Her corral is located in the posterior section of her house. She feeds them balanced feed so that they will reach an ideal development. She will offer them for sale at the different market s in the region to obtain very good profits which will be used to cover the family’s expenses. 

Josefa has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase more livestock and their feed and to improve the corral where she keeps her pigs. Her goal is to raise and resell them at a better price, so to improve the quality of life in her home. Josefa is a very responsible and hardworking person who is always conscious of improving her business and to keep providing for their needs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis tiene 37 años de edad, vive con sus esposa y sus dos menores hijos.
