Cuenta con casa propia la cual está ubicada en una  zona urbana marginal  del distrito de la Victoria, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La vivienda cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua  el lugar donde vive esta poblándose.	

Luis se dedica al servicio de transporte público, en su unidad móvil, un taxi que es de su propiedad, el trabaja todo el día, con estos ingresos Luis cubre los gastos de sus hogar. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, en los que a adquirido experiencia en el rubro

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles, para que con este dinero, el pueda comprar una computadora para ayudar a que el desarrollo académico de sus hijos sea mas optimo. Luis desea que con este equipo sus hijos puedan desarrollar sus tareas con mayor facilidad.

 Luis cuenta con buenas referencias personales y crediticias, el a demostrado a Edpyme Alternativa, sus puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Luis is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two young children. He has his own home in a marginal urban area within the District of La Victoria, which is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. His home receives electricity and water since he lives in a populated area.

Luis provides public transportation services using the taxi that he owns. He works every day and the income that he earns goes toward the household expenses. Luis has been in business for five years and has acquired experience in this line of work.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can purchase a computer for his children. He hopes that this piece of equipment will help them academically by allowing them to have an easier time completing their schoolwork.

Luis has good personal and credit references. He has demonstrated to Edpyme Alternativa that he is punctual and responsible.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for his children.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and married with four adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell. Each month, Elizabeth earns about Php 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela María, tiene la edad de 27 años, está soltera y vive con sus padres. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una vaca de leche. Ella cuenta con le área especial para el mantenimiento de este animal y poder satisfacer sus necesidades de alimentacion en buenas condiciones. Ella pretende tener ganancias de este nuevo proyecto y darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida. También lo que pretende es obtener de la vaca una cría y para su posterior venta y así tener mayores ganancias. 

Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gabriela María is 27 years old.  She’s single living with her parents.  She intends to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.  She has a special space where she can keep the animal, feed it and provide good living conditions.  She intends to earn profits from this new project and provide her family with a better standard of living.  She also intends to obtain a calf from the cow to sell subsequently thus earning higher profits.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any prior loans with state banks.  FUDECUSUR has offered a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Justino

texts.en:
Justino is 60 years old and married with two children. 

He is the owner and operator of a sauna. His sauna is very popular and many people go there to relax and treat themselves to a wonderful day. 

Justino is asking for a $1,200 loan to improve his sauna and he wishes to make repairs to aspects of the sauna that are worn out. 

He is a very responsible man and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his sauna.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 32-year-old man, married since 2006. He has three children. 

In order to provide his kids with a good standard of living, Bassam opened a small restaurant three years ago that serves take-away sandwiches. Using his experience for almost 10 years has helped him gain a lot of customers from the day he started.

Now Bassam has applied for this loan to redecorate the restaurant and add another type of sandwiches called "shawerma".

loans.use: To redecorate the restaurant and add another type of sandwiches called "shawerma".

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Mrs. Or learned farming from her grandparents and has spent the last three years raising crops. She is now married and has three school-aged children. Her husband frequently works in the field with her, and they have been very successful as farmers. The couple is able to plant two crops a year, one in the rainy seaS. and the other in the dry seaS.. She is applying for this loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, a pump and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, a pump and seeds.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 36 and married to Army. Together, with her husband, she is bringing up three children. The first son is at school and the other two are preschool age. 

Olivia is a rolling vendor in the community. She stocks a variety of vegetables that she can sell door to door to the people of the community. Olivia is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, and beans. She has been doing this kind of work for one year. She is well known in the community as a hardworking and very patience person.

In the future, she wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beans, cabbages, tomatoes and squash for her rolling vendor.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario de 64 años de edad tiene un negocio de preparación de comidas y venta de víveres en general, desde hace 20 años cuando inició con una tienda, y su familia adquirió el lote donde en la actualidad se encuentra su negocio y fueron construyendo poco a poco. Su principal clientela son las amas de casa que compran productos de la canasta familiar, como gradualmente observó las necesidades prácticas de la población objeto, adicionó su otra actividad: la venta de comidas con la que también genera ingresos importantes para el buen desempeño de su hogar. Su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr invertir en compras en mayor volumen y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para la preparación de los alimentos, y víveres para surtir su tienda.  En su negocio maneja unos buenos índices de liquidez, lo que le dan la oportunidad de afrontar sus compromisos a corto plazo, sus ventas son mayormente de contado y sus inventarios rotan rápidamente, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos que su inversión sea exitosa.
texts.en:
Mario, 64, has a business preparing meals and selling foodstuffs in general.  He started out 20 years ago with a store and his family acquired the lot that the store is currently located on and they gradually built.  His main customers are housewives who buy basic food items.  He gradually noticed practical needs in his community so he added another activity: selling meals that also generate important income for the good development of his home.

His greatest challenge is working capital that’s insufficient to be able to invest in larger volume purchases and this is precisely the reason for his calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing he does with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy raw materials to prepare the meals and foodstuffs to stock his store.

He manages good liquidity indexes in his business which gives him the ability to repay debts in short periods of time.  His sales are mostly cash and his inventories turn over quickly.  From these financial indicators we can project potential growth and we can augur that his investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare the meals and foodstuffs to stock his store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a businessman who has a motorbike transport business. His business is only one year old. He has sustained his business because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya. His desire is to grow the business and buy a van for his transport business.

Samuel has requested 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.ru: Шарафнисо жительница города. Худжанд. Ей 35 лет. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Она имеет среднее образование. Шарафнисо уже четыре года как занимается торговлей. Она открыла магазин, где продает женскую одежду и бижутерию. Кредит берет для приобретения осеней одежды, то есть сезонного товара.
texts.en: Sharafniso lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 35 years old, divorced and has one child.  She has a secondary education.  Sharafniso has been involved in retail sales for four years.  She opened a store, where she sells women's clothing and jewelry.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of autumn clothing, i.e. seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy autumn clothing

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким трудолюбивый и ответственный. Он женат у него 5 детей. Хаким  занимается дехканским делом более 6 лет. Он занимается выращиванием таких овощей как лук, картошка, морковь и др. Хаким имеет большой опыт в этом деле. На участке он выращивает экологически  чистые и качественные  продукты, благодаря чему его продукты всегда имеют спрос среди клиентов. Хаким хочет получить займ на сумму 6500 сомони для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. Эти средства помогут повысить урожайность и избавиться от вредных насекомых. Надеясь на вашу поддержку он выражает вам свою признательность.
texts.en: Hakim is a hardworking and responsible person.  He is married and has five children.  Hakim is involved in a dekhan (farming) business for over six years.  He grows vegetables, such as onions, potatoes, carrots and others.  Hakim has an extensive experience in this business.  He grows ecologically clean and quality products on his land, and, thanks to this, his products are always in high demand among customers.  Hakim wants to obtain a loan in the sum 6500 somoni for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.  These means will help him increase harvestability and eliminate harmful insects.  Hoping to get your support, Hakim expresses his gratitude to you.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana y su esposo tienen un negocio D. confecciones ambos trabajan en él para sacar a su familia adelante tienen 03 hijos que aun están en edad escolar, por su lado Ana tiene un negocio pequeño que empezó con sus ahorros y es la venta D. golosinas, esto le ha permitido poder ayudar un poquito más con los gastos D. la casa  sobre todo con la educación  D. sus hijos, los prestamos D. EDAPROSPO le permitieron juntar mas capital para que su negocio siga creciendo ahora tiene su tienda surtida D. golosinas, ella pertenece al grupo comunal  “ MUJERES FORJADORAS” un grupo muy unido y trabajador  para más adelante quiere buscar un lugar más granD. donD. trasladar su negocio y poder  ampliarlo para vender abarrotes, por ahora con el dinero obtenido D. su préstamo comprara algunas telas y  otra parte le servirá para comprar golosinas para vender.
*Ana es la ultima D. la fila viste cafarena crema
texts.en:
Ana and her husband have a clothing business where both of them work in order to get their family ahead. They have three school-aged children. At the same time, Ana has a small business selling snacks that she started with her savings. This has allowed her to help more with the household expenses, especially with the education of their children. The loans from EDAPROSPO allowed her to gather more capital so that her business could continue to grow and her store is now filled with snacks. Ana is a member of Mujeres Forjadoras Communal Bank, a very close-knit and hardworking group. In the future she wants to find a larger venue for her business, expanding it with grocery sales. For now, she will use a part of the loan to buy fabrics, and the other part to buy snacks to sell.

* Ana is the last in line wearing the cream-colored turtleneck.

loans.use: to buy fabric and snacks.

loans.name: Mukenyeziterimbere Group

texts.fr:
Thomas est un commerçant âgé de 43ans qui habite la localité de Bukirasazi de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il vend du the et du pain depuis 22 ans. Il commence ce métier alors qu’il fait le commerce de restaurant. Il a fait juste l’alphabétisation des adultes comme formation jusqu’en 2e année. Son épouse, Leoncie est une cultivatrice et 8 enfants dont 5 sont à l’école.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 290,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de the et de pains  à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« MukenyeziTerimbere"
texts.en:
Thomas is 43-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Bukirasazi, in the province of Gitega, a central region. He is a member of the MukenyeziTerimbere community group. He has been selling tea and bread for 22 years, and started this activity while working in the restaurant business. He attended two years of adult literacy training. His wife Leoncie is a farmer. They have eight children, five of whom go to school. 

He is seeking a loan of 290,000 Burundi francs to increase his working capital. He will buy large quantities of tea and bread to sell in order to make substantial profits and increase his savings.

loans.use: to stock up on tea and bread for resale

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en: Eddah is married and blessed with three children. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. She has been practicing poultry farming to support her family. She also runs a grocery business to supplement her income. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Eddah is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy more chickens to raise. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Ayidote 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE6 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amis et appartiennent à une même association d’artisans. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Ivadagbé Mensmin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ivadagbé Mensmin est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Ivadagbé Mensmin est marié à une marchande du nom de Jacqueline. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de ses enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à sa charge. Ivadagbé Mensmin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Ivadagbé Mensmin fait depuis huit ans de la couture dans son quartier. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Ivadagbé Mensmin désire mieux équiper son atelier, par l'acquisition de fournitures de couture et accessoires de machine ; ce qui lui permettra d'accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour ce faire, Ivadagbé Mensmin sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE6, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group AYIDOTE6 is comprised of three persons whose are friends belonging to the same artisans’ association. This is the third time the group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, named Ivadagbé Mensmin, is the one in the photo with his hand raised. He is 32 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant by the name of 
Jacqueline. They have two children, both in school and in their care. In addition to the two children, the couple has another child to support.

Ivadagbé Mensmin lives together with his wife and children, and the couple jointly cover the diverse family expenses. To help with these expenses, he has been a clothier in his district for eight years. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers, Ivadagbé Mensmin would like to equip his workshop better by acquiring sewing supplies and equipment. This will enable him to increase his sales and revenues. To do so, he and the other members of the group AYIDOTE6 are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and machine accessories

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 44 años de edad, vive con Fernando, su pareja, con quien tiene 6 hijos, la mayoría de ellos ya tiene su propia familia. Por eso ella y su pareja viven con la menor de 8 años en una casa propia en la localidad de Puente Paucartambo, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Rosa y Fernando, son una dupla increíble. Son como 20 años aproximadamente que comparten sus vidas en el cuidado y educación de sus hijos. Es así que, en las 5 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivos tienen sembrados 30 quintales de granos de café, árboles de naranjas, limones y paltas.
Esta actividad le permitió conseguir el capital necesario para adquirir una camioneta, la que maneja uno de sus hijos mayores. Con la movilidad realiza el servicio de flete y traslada las cosechas de sus vecinos hacia la ciudad, que mayormente son frutas en cajones de madera. “Por cada viaje estamos cobrando como 80 soles, eso varía de acuerdo a la cantidad de la carga”, menciona.
Es así como trabaja coordinadamente con su hijo, cuyos ingresos benefician a ambos.
Entre los anhelos de Rosa, está el ver a su hija de 8 años realizarse profesionalmente y educarse con estudios superiores, por esa razón seguirá trabajando hasta conseguir sus metas. Gracias a la recomendación de los socios del banco comunal “Luz del Futuro”, Sandra ingresó como una integrante más. Por eso éste sería su primer crédito de MFP, entusiasta confirma que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales a establecerse.
De obtener el dinero del préstamo, ella podrá comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de café, que según calcula estarán listos para la cosecha en el mes de mayo y junio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and lives with her husband, Fernando.  They have six children, most of whom have their own families now.  However their youngest daughter of 8 still lives with them in a home of their own, located in Puente Paucartambo, within the Chanchamayo province.  Rosa and Fernando are an incredible couple.  They’ve shared their lives for about 20 years, educating and caring for their children.  They have 30 quintals of coffee, orange trees, lemons, and avocados planted on 5 hectares.

This activity allowed them to save up the necessary capital to buy a small truck, which one of their older sons drives.  They provide freight services with this vehicle and move the harvests, most of the time crates of fruit, for their neighbors in town.  She says, “We charge about 80 PEN for each trip, but it depends on the amount of freight.”

In this way she works in coordination with her son and the income benefits both.

Among Rosa’s desires, she wants to see her eight year old daughter develop a professional career and get a higher education.  For this reason, she will continue working until she reaches her goals.  Thanks to the recommendation of some of the members of the “Luz del Futuro” (Light of the Future) communal bank, Sandra also joined.  This will be [Rosa’s] first loan through MFP.  She enthusiastically states that she will be on time with the monthly payments.

Upon receiving the money from this loan, she will be able to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for her coffee crops, which she estimates will be ready to harvest in May and June.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат занимается скотоводством уже более 10 лет с целью увлечения поголовья скота. Несколько лет он был на заработках в России, и деньги ему достались с трудом, приехав в свой дом, сразу же начал заниматься скотоводством. На заработанные деньги купил 8 голов овца и 2 голов корову, таким образом, за годами он увеличил поголовье скота. В данный момент он имеет 40 голов овца и 6 голов корову.  Сегодня он нуждается расширить сарай своего скота, потому что они не поместится в зиме, а если он не строит сарай для них, а то ему придется продавать часть овца, но сегодняшней день в базаре покупает по низкой цене и ему не выгодно продавать их. Шавкат запрашивает займ в размере 7000 Сомони для покупки стройматериалов для постройки сарая, а на остаточную сумму хочет купить овца и корма для них. Шавкат надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Shavkat has been involved in animal husbandry for over ten years, with the goal of increasing livestock headcount.  He spent several years working in Russia, and earning that money was not easy.  He returned home and got involved in animal husbandry right away.  Shavkat used his earnings to purchase eight heads of sheep and two heads of cattle and was able to increase livestock headcount over the years like this.  Currently, he has forty heads of sheep and six heads of cattle.  Today, he needs to expand the barn for his livestock because it will not fit there in the winter.  If Shavkat does not build a barn for the livestock, then he would have to sell some of the sheep, which would not be economical, since he is buying sheep at low prices now.  Shavkat is requesting a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni to purchase construction materials to build a barn, and to use the rest of the money to purchase sheep and fodder for it.  Shavkat relies on your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a barn, and to purchase sheep and fodder

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es:
Johana quien habita  en Leon , se dedica a una de las labores propias de las comunidades aledañas a la ciudad la crianza de cerdo . Tiene dos  hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad . Inicio su negocio a los 22 años de edad aunque su primer negocio fue la venta de sodas , tacos , bolsitas pero después se dedicó a la crianza de cerdo que es donde vio la oportunidad de crecer como mujer de negocio y sacar adelante a su familia. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de cerdos de reproducción. Quiere especializarse en técnicas que le ayuden a la crianza de este tipo de animales además de poner una pequeña pulpería que es uno de sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Johana, who live in Leon, works at one of the occupations associated with the communities surrounding the town, that of pig breeding. She has two children, aged 8 and 2. She started this business when she was 22, however her first business involved selling sodas, tacos and cartons of beverages. She later turned to pig breeding where she saw the opportunity to grow as a business woman and move her family forward. 

She needs this loan to buy breeding pigs. She wants to specialize in techniques that help in breeding this type of animal. Another of her projects is to set up a small store.

loans.use: to purchase breeding pigs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old.  She is married to Peter and they have one child. She has been selling second hand clothes for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is requesting her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd.  She intends to use the funds to purchase second hand clothes for her business. With the anticipated profit, she will save to venture into farming. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child and to have a good life.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Juan no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Juan trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de la vivienda de sus padres con quienes vive, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo y puesta de un piso de concreto, de esta manera Juan podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Juan is a 28 year old single man who lives in Camaná.  He is a friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a strong desire to succeed.  Regrettably, because of a lack of financial resources and the need to pay his expenses, Juan was not able to study for a professional degree although he would have really liked to have been able to do so.  In his free time, Juan enjoys playing football with his friends.  

By his own initiative and thanks to his mother’s support, Juan works as a taxi driver, offering transportation services in the city.  He works every day starting early in the morning and may work about twelve hours.  He feels at ease doing his job and believes that it is going well because of his responsibility and the friendly treatment he provides to his customers.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a baker in her village. She did not have any form of formal education. 

Aba bakes bread. She bakes her bread in a locally-made oven which is made of red clay, molded round with an open space in front of it. She supplies the bread to retailers, both near and far, as well as individuals around her locality,  Ayensudu, located in Elmina. She has been involved in this business for quite some time. 

Aba is divorced with four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her children in paying their children’s school fees and other general expenses. 

She has noticed that there are growing demands for her bread among consumers. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited funding. 

Thus, Aba aims to use her loan to purchase a modern oven, flour, sugar, and other ingredients for the bakery. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba wants to ensure that all her children are given the opportunity of education, to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a modern oven, flour, sugar, and other ingredients for the bakery.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenechimeg, 31 years old, lives with her husband and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been running a photography studio since 2007. Her husband also drives a bus at university. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to grow vegetables such as carrots, potatoes and cabbage. By doing so, their family will save cash on vegetables and can sell the surplus vegetables for profit. It can substantially help her family to improve their living standard. Also growing vegetables absorbs oxygen, reducing air pollution in the process.

loans.use: to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Kitunda area in Dar es Salaam.She is not married and has two children.One in primary school and another in secondary school.
Maria keeps layers and broilers nearby her residence.She is in a plan of adding the flock of chickens from 400 she usually kept to 600.Maria has to employ one person in her business to take charge of the increased stock. The expansion strategy need some additional funding as more chicks are to be added and a stock of poultry  feed.The expansion  plan will enable Maria pay for school fees for her secondary school children and increase income for her family. To implement her growth plan she need additional capital of  USD 400.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en:
Shukur is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied Lachin region of Azerbaijan.  He now lives in Sumgait city. Shukur is 26 years old and been in the clothing business for 4 years.  He supports his family from this occupation. 
Now he needs a loan amount of $1,200 to open his own clothes store.

loans.use: To open his own clothes store

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny has 6 years’ experience with her business of selling cosmetics and jewelry. She has been working since she was in school helping her mother. She would take products to sell them at school. In a way, it was her mother who started the business. Once she was of legal age, she decided to start buying her own products. The reason she is asking for a loan is that she was pregnant and had to stop working for one year. Now she works everyday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Jenny wants to use the loan to invest in her business. She wants buy other products that for the lack of working capital she hasn’t been able to.

Jenny is a single mother. She is 24 years old and she has 2 children. Currently, she is separated from her husband. She lives in a house that belongs to her in-laws. They have practically given it to her to live. In spite of their separation, the father of her children helps them every month.

Jenny’s wish is to be able to buy a used car that would help her with her business and have a bigger income.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Jenny tiene una experiencia ya de 6 años con su negocio de venta de cosméticos y bisutería. Desde la época de colegio ella ya trabajaba por medio de su mama. Llevaba productos a vender a su unidad educativa. Su mama fue la que prácticamente la inicio con el negocio. Una vez cumplida la mayoría de edad decide comprar sus propios productos. El embarazo que ella tuvo la dejo sin trabajar un año motivo por el cual esta solicitando crédito. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.

Jenny desea el crédito para invertir en su negocio. Además desea poder incluir otros productos los que por falta de capital no lo ha hecho.

Jenny es madre soltera. Tiene 24 años y 2 hijos. Actualmente esta separada de su esposo. Vive en una casa que es de sus suegros la que prácticamente se la han obsequiado para que viva con sus hijos. A pesar de la separación con el padre de sus hijos este le ayuda mensualmente. Su deseo es poder comprarse un carrito de segunda. Con el que le ayudaría bastante en la movilización de su negocio y por ende obtendría mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maria Isidra

texts.en:
Mrs. Isidra is a single mother who has two married sons. She now lives alone with a grandchild, and she takes care of the cost of his studies and living expenses, the course she considers him to be one of her children. In order to obtain an income that allows her to increase the quality of their life five years ago she started her own business selling groceries. Her grandson helps her out, and together they have been able to get the business ahead and make it grow.

Through offering good service they have been able to increase their clientele and further develop the business. Now, Isidra is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to have a better variation of products. She commits to repay this amount in six months. Please become an important part in the life of this family. Help Isidra out, she sincerely thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isidra es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que ya están casados, ahora ella vive sola con un nieto, y se encarga de cubrir los gastos de sus estudios y manutención, porque ella lo considera como un hijo más. Para poder obtener un ingreso que le permitiera mejorar su calidad de vida, desde hace cinco años inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, donde recibe la ayuda de su nieto, juntos han logrado sacar adelante el negocio y hacerlo crecer.

El buen servicio que ofrecen les ha permitido incrementar sus clientes y lograr un buen desarrollo del negocio, ahora Isidra solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, así tendrán una mayor variedad de productos, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Isidra, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Mr. Ever Martinez is a single, 24 year old who lives with his parents in the city of Caaguazú.

Ever is a young entrepreneur who, with the help of his parents, began his own business 5 years ago. Additionally, he has faithful customers who always come back because of the excellent service that he provides and because of the high quality of his products. Among the products that he sells are: nails, hammers, cables, paint, chainsaws, etc.

Ever is asking for a loan in order to enlarge his store, as one of his dreams is to attach a cell phone store to his hardware store. For this he needs to buy cell phones, cases, charges, etc. With this store, he will be able to offer his clients a greater variety of stock, while continuing to provide the good service that he is known for and retaining faithful clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Ever Martinez de 24 años de edad, es soltero, actualmente se encuentra viviendo con sus padres en la ciudad de Caaguazú.

Ever es un jóven emprendedor que ya cuenta con su negocio propio el cual inicio hace 5 años con la ayuda de sus padres, además cuenta con una clientela bien formada que acuden al local por el excelente servicio que él les otorga y por sus productos de buena calidad. Entre los productos que vende citamos: clavos, martillos, cables, pintura, motocierras, etc.

Ever solicita el préstamo para la ampliación de su local ya que uno de sus sueños personales es anexar a su ferretería, un puesto de ventas de celulares necesita comprar celulares, estuches, cargadores,etc. Y asi ofrecer a sus clientes un stock más variado de productos, con la buena atención que le caracteriza y seguir manteniendolos como clientes fieles de su empresa.

loans.use: For the purchase of cellular phones, cases, charges, etc.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun P., 39, married, has six children and lives with her husband in Batambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her five children who are in school, while her sixth child and her husband work in construction. Mrs. P. is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase more construction tools for her family members to operate their business.

loans.use: Purchase of construction tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replenish his inventory and perform maintenance on his copier

loans.name: Leonor De Rosario

texts.en:
Leonor is thirty-six years old, and she and her husband have four children, three of them boys, that go to the public school in their community. Three years ago, Leonor started a small business, selling beauty products and women’s clothing and sneakers. In the morning, after preparing meals for the children, Leonor goes down to the streets to sell her goods. In the afternoon, people visit her home to purchase garments. Currently, that activity is the principal source of income of the family.

The entrepreneur hopes that her business can keep growing and that she can get more clients. With her loan, she will buy clothing in bulk outside her community, in a frontier city with Haiti, where garments can be obtained at low prices. That way, Leonor can increase her income and profits.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothing in bulk to keep on running her business

loans.name: Henriqueta Sebastião

texts.pt:
Henriqueta Sebastião M. is married and has 3 children. She raises Chickens. She entered the program with a group and borrowed $75.00, and now she is doing it alone. She is in the 3rd cycle and is asking for $350.00 to be paid back in 4 months. She will use the money to invest in raising chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Henriqueta Sebastião M., portador do BI nº110259766C vive maritalmente tem 3 filhos é criadora de Pintos entrou no programa como grupo e tomava 1800 ,a gora esta a levar so esta no 3 coclo vai tomar o valor de 8000 a para em 4 meses valor é para investir na criação de pintos

loans.use: Purchase chickens

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Jurabek Bobokalanovich G., 41, lives in Varzob district with his wife and three children. He has a techinal college education; by training he is a cinema engineer. However, he doesn't work in this field. Jurabek has a private livestock business. He buys cattle at the district market and then re-sells them at the country markets for better prices. Jurabek has about ten years of experience in this business. Because it is the main source of income for his family, Jurabek has fine-tuned his business for maximum success. He is applying for a loan to increase turnover. He plans to repay the loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Гафуров Джурабек Бобокалонович житель района Варзоб . Возраст 41 год, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование средне-техническое. По профессии кинотехник. Не работает по специальности. Занимается частным предпринимательством в сфере животноводства. покупает и перепродает крупно-рогатый скот. Покупает на районном рынке и перепродает на рынке в кишлаке по более выгодной цене. Опыт в данной сфере около 10 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому его бизнес налажен очень хорошо.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Aminah Diana

texts.en: Diana is a 43 year-old married resident of Sapeman in the Greater Accra region of Ghana.  She has over 8 years of experience in the retail sales of used clothing and other cloth items such as curtains.  She is seeking a loan of $500 (8 months) so as to expand her business to serve the market in adjacent communities.

loans.use: Aminah is looking to expand her business to serve the market in adjacent communities.

loans.name: Concepcion De

texts.es:
Concepción is 64 years old and sells food in the Villa México market. She also rents out crockery. She lives with her husband and 30-year old son. Her husband helps her out in the business as well working in construction. Her son lives with his parents but is completely independent. Concepción and her husband have managed the business for a long time. She prepares the food in her own home and then goes to the market to sell it. She’s had more than 17 years of experience selling food and also gets income from her crockery rental business. There isn’t a lot of competition since not many people are in this line of business, and as she’s been around for a long time, she has a permanent stall in the market. She is well known by both customers and the shopkeepers. With the loan she plans to build a roof on her house. This is Concepción’s third loan. Her previous loans were paid back as planned although it should be mentioned that they were a few days late.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Concepción de 64 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comidas en el mercado de Villa México y también al alquiler de vajilla. Concepción vive sola con su esposo y su hijo de 30 años. El esposo es quien le ayuda en las actividades del comercio, tambien se dedica a la construccion. Por otra parte, el hijo solo vive con sus padres ya que es completamente independiente. Concepción se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo junto a su esposo. Las comidas las prepara en su domicilio particular, para luego ir a venderlas en el mercado, cuenta con mas de 17 años de experiencia en la venta de comidas. Adicionalmente cuenta con ingresos del alquiler de vajillas. Cuenta con competencia moderada, ya que no son muchas las vendedoras del mismo rubro. por otra parte, tiene un puesto fijo en el mercado por ser antigua. Y es bastante conocida en el mercado por clientes y comerciantes. Con el credito obtenido, efectuará trabajos de techado en su domicilio. Es la tercera sencuencia de la Concepción. Los anteriores créditos los canceló con normalidad, cabe mencionar que tuvo algunos días de retraso.

loans.use: Roof construction

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is 57 years old and married with three children. She operates a provision store in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She learned her trade by herself. She said, “I want to use this Kiva loan to buy more provisions for sales, most especially those things my customers demand more. I thank LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their assistance.”

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food items to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
In the municipality of El Sause in the city of Leon, Francisca A. works hard to achieve her goal of improving her household living conditions by purchasing a solar panel to generate electricity because her community does not have electricity. This panel will be installed on the roof of her house and in this way will provide her house with electricity.

Now that she has bought the solar panel she would like to repay her debt. For this reason she is seeking Ceprodel's support to obtain the necessary loan to pay for the panel so that she can continue to work hard and be able to perform household chores using the electricity from the solar panel.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, la señora Francisca A. se dedica a laborar fuertemente con el único propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por medio de la compra de un panel solar el cual genera energía eléctrica ya que en su comunidad nunca ha contado con esta. Este panel solar se instala en el techo de la casa y de esta manera abastece a la vivienda en general con energia electrica.

Hoy en día, al haber adquirido el panel solar tiene la obligación de cancelar esta deuda y por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para el pago del panel para así continuar con su ardua labor y poder realizar los quehaceres del hogar con el apoyo del panel solar.

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel to supply her house with electricity

loans.name: Cecilia Armida

texts.es:
Señorita Cecilia is 57 years old. She finished college, and lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. At the end of her studies, she took up teaching but had to have an operation for a tumor in her throat, and had to leave her job. Because of this she began selling food, an activity that helped her cover her expenses. She currently works preparing food and selling breakfast in the morning and food at night. In the middle of the day, she makes refreshments for children in the twelve pre-schools that operate in the neighborhood of Victor Larco. On the weekends she caters food for parties as ordered by her clients. She is the secretary of the Community Bank "Las Palmeras." In this bank she recieved her first loan of S/.300.00 with which she bought rice, oil, and vermicelli noodles. With this loan of S/.1,300.00 that she will repay over a period of 6 months she will buy tables, chairs, and non-perishable snacks. In the near future, she wants to improve her house and improve the ambiance of the location where she sells her food.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Cecilia tiene 57 años de edad, estudió educación superior completa; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Al terminar sus estudios se dedicó a la docencia pero al ser operada de un tumor en la garganta tuvo que dejar el trabajo por eso es que se dedicó a la venta de comida, actividad que le ayudó a cubrir sus gastos. Actualmente se dedica a preparar comida y vender desayuno por las mañanas y comida por las noches ya que al medio día colabora con la preparación de los refrigerios para los niños de los doce wawa huasis que funcionan en el Distrito de Victor Larco; los fines de semana prepara comida para atender agasajos según pedido de sus clientes Es secretaria del Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS” en este banco recibió su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró arroz, aceite y fideos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará mesas, sillas y alimentos no perecibles. En un plazo no muy largo quiere mejorar su casa y el ambiente donde vende la comida para mejorar la apariencia.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and ingredients

loans.name: Socorro De Los Santo

texts.es:
Mrs. Socorro de los Angeles Rojas P., is 52 years old, she is single and has a son who is 14 years old and is studying high school, her partner is a nurse assistant, one of her purposes is to grow her business in order to contribute more income to her home to survive the current situation. Her wish is to install in her house a good space to sell her products and provide her clients with better attention, she would like to have a showcase and so the experience would be more comfortable for her clients. She sells general merchandise like: shoes, beauty supplies, perfumes and clothes.
 Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.


la señora Socorro de los Angeles Rojas P., de 52 años de edad,su estado civil es de soltera tiene un hijo,la edad de su hijo es de 14 años,esta cursando la secundaria, su compañero de vida que se desempeña en auxiliar de enfermeria,uno de sus propositos es poder ampliar su negocio de esta manera contribuir con los ingresos del hogar traves de los cual  se haria menos dificil de no ser por el credito y poder sobrellevar la situacion actual en la que se encuentra, su deseo es llegar a instalar en su casa la venta de mercadería adecuada de sus productos y asi darle al cliente una mejor atencion,sus sueños son poder llegar a tener una venta  en su casa con vitrinas donde se realizara su venta y con mejor comodida para cliente,lo que  ella desea es lograr establecerse e incrementar su clientes y su productos ya que esto le ayudara en su economia personal,su negocio es de mercaderia en general como lo son: zapatos,cosmeticos,perfumenes y ropa variada,su negocio lo empieza por una compañero que le dio motivos para poder tener otra forma de ganarse la vida.

loans.use: Working Capital / CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Rom Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chea R. is the group leader of four who all live in Chrouy Ampil Thmey Village in Kandal Province. Now single and living with her mother, Chea is a scarf weaver and seller who makes a small income to support her family. Since she has many customers and not enough scarves to sell, she is requesting a loan to buy more scarves to meet customer demand. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more scarves to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Kozima

texts.en: Kozima K.  has been a widow for the past 15 years. Since she lost her husband, all family expenses fall on her shoulders. Kozima purchases dried apricots from small markets in her town, processes them at home and sells them at the central market every weekend. She has to wake up early in the morning to get the best apricots available at the best price.  A loan would help her to expand her business and to reach her dream of providing a high education for her children.

loans.use: Expand and Grow her apricot business

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: EL  GRUPO PRIMAVERA ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA BERONICA, EN ESTE BANCO COMUNAL EXISTE PARENTESCO ENTRE LAS SRAS. ANGELA Y MARTHA TEREZA QUE SON HERMANAS, AL IGUAL ENTRE LAS SRAS. CLAUDIA  Y MARIA , TAMBIÉN EXISTE PARENTESCO ENTRE LAS SRAS. MATILD.  Y LA Sra. MERCEDES PERO ESO NO REPRESENTA DIFICULTAD YA QUE CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENE INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES. EN ESTE BANCO COMUNAL LOS SOCIOS SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. COSMÉTICOS , VENTA D. COMIDA, VENTA D. PAN, VENTA D. ROPA Y OTRAS ACTIVIDADES RELACIONAS CON LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. LA ÉPOCA. LA GRAN MAYORÍA REQUIERE EL DINERO PARA INCREMENTAR LOS INSUMOS Y EL MATERIAL QUE PONEN A LA VENTA. ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE TRABAJAN CON  LA FUNDACIÓN PERO ESTÁN SEGUROS D. CUMPLIR CON LOS PAGOS PORQUE SON GENTE TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE.
texts.en:
The “Primavera” (Spring) Group is represented by Beronica. In this communal bank there are a few related members: Angela and Martha are sisters, as are Claudia and Maira, and MatilD. and Mercedes are related. These relationships do not represent a difficulty as each of the members has independent income. In this communal bank the members sell cosmetics, food, bread, clothing and other businesses related to seasonal products. The majority require money to increase stock and materials used in their sales. This is the firs ttime they are working with the Foundation but they are sure they can make their payments because they are hard-working and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ năm nay 35 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đều đi buôn bán hoa quả. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với  những kinh ngjiệm đã được tích luỹ trong nhiều năm và  sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị Huệ đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập  ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 20.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh daonh hoa quả tăng thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Huệ is 35 years old. She, her husband, and their 2 children live in Ninh Giang district in the province of Hải Dương. They sell fruits and vegetables for a living, this is their main source of income. They have had multiple loans before which were used effectively combined with their experience in this domain, their business has become quite successful. Their income is 3.000.000 VND a month. This time Mrs Huệ is requesting a loan of 20.000.000 VND to invest in their business thus to increase their income in the long run.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her fruits & vegetables business

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha Y. is a group leader of five women who all live in Tumnob village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sokha Y. is a pig breeder. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy three more piglets, and she would use the rest of the money to buy seven chickens for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. San Sak, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Mrs. Sokha Y. is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

Three members in this loan group have monthly payment loans, and two have end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva's Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three more piglets and seven chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Más de veinte años es el tiempo que Basilia ha dedicado a la venta de pescado a domicilio. Sus tres hijos en ese entonces aún pequeños, fueron quienes la motivaron a iniciarse en este negocio. Gracias a una amiga pudo conseguir el capital inicial para empezar a trabajar. Y desde entonces no se ha detenido. 

Antes ella trabajaba de servicio en casas, haciendo limpieza o lavando ropa, pero abandono este oficio pues no tenía quien cuide a sus hijos, pues ella ha sido madre soltera.

A sus cuarenta y ocho años y con sus hijos ya mayores e independientes ella ya no solo vende pescado sino también tunas cuando es su temporada. Más adelante esta pensando vender comida en su propia casa y solo los fines de semana, buscando tener un trabajo más estable y no tan perjudicial para su bienestar físico. Le gustaría además tener una tienda pero esto requiere de una inversión más grande y verificar si vale la pena arriesgarse.
texts.en:
Basilia has been selling fish door-to-door for more than 20 years. Her three children, who were still young at the time, were the ones who motivated her to start her business. Thanks to a friend she was able to obtain the start-up capital to begin working, and she hasn't stopped since. She used to work in people's houses, cleaning and doing laundry, but she left that work because she didn't have anyone to take care of her children, since she is a single mother. Now that she is 48 years old and her children are grown-up and independent, she not only sells fish but also prickly pears when they're in season. In the future she is thinking about selling food in her own home on the weekends, hoping to have work that is more stable and not as damaging to her physical health. She would also like to have a store, but that will require a larger investment and she must make sure the financial risk is worth it.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food to sell

loans.name: Nolasco

texts.es:
Invirtió para aumentar la mercancía de su tienda.
A sus sesenta y un años, Nolasco tiene a cargo el negocio que sustenta la familia, un hijo todavía menor de edad, y a su esposa inválida. 
Nolasco dedicó casi toda su vida a trabajos en diferentes empresas, como personal de limpieza principalmente, trabajo en el cual recién, en enero de este año, logró jubilarse y conseguir una pensión que lo ayude ahora a cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
Hace seis años su esposa perdió sus piernas, así que el tuvo que encontrar una manera de trabajar y poder cuidar de ella a la misma vez. Entonces abrió una tiendita de abarrotes en su propia casa. Hace pocos meses empezó a sacar préstamos de EDAPROSPO, y en el futuro espera poder mejorar su tienda y su hogar, y tal vez disponer de servicios como Internet.
texts.en:
He invested to increase the goods in his store. At 71 years of age, Nolasco is responsible for the store which supports his family, a son still a minor, and his disabled wife. Nolasco has spent almost his entire life working in different businesses, mainly as a cleaner. Recently, in January of this year, he managed to retire and receive a pension which now helps him to cover the household expenses. Six years ago, his wife lost her legs and so he had to find a way of working and of caring for her at the same time. To do this he opened a small grocery store in his home. A few months ago he began taking loans from EDAPROSPO and in the future he hopes to make improvements to his store and his home and perhaps even get services such as the internet.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods for retail

loans.name: Lauren Adhiambo

texts.en:
Lauren Adhiambo O. is a 22-year-old mother of two children aged 10 and 7, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and sells fruit in Obunga at a small kiosk. She will use this loan to purchase more stock. She wanted borrowers to know that she is also an orphan, and will use the loan and profits from her business to pay for her children’s school fees.

Lauren recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Con Esfuerzo Triunfaremos 4 Group

texts.en:
The members of this group, belonging to the Bank of Hope "Con Esfuerzo Triunfaremos" (We Will Succeed with Effort), are requesting their second loan since they've been clients of Esperanza International. This group of entrepreneurs lives in Consuelo, an area of San Pedro de Macoris known for being the hometown of baseball stars like Sammy Sosa. Consuelo was established around a sugar cane factory that is no longer operating. This has brought serious unemployment and left many acres of State-property land that are not being used right now because no one is planting on them after the sugar cane industry collapse. This has forced many people to become self-employed and set up their own businesses.

Roxana O. is the group representative and has a miscellaneous store. She sells all kinds of items, and will restock her inventory using the loan she has requested. She hopes to expand it to a large department store one day, so that people in Consuelo won't have to travel to San Pedro de Macoris (about 40 minutes away) to do their shopping.

Please help us support these microentrepreneurship initiatives through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Restock inventory in miscellaneous store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C.  manages an auto repair shop. She is 43 years old and all of her 3 children are in school. Her husband, Filipino C. knows how to repair cars, motorcycles and other automobiles. This has been their business since they were first married and had children.

Rebecca is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. ( First Filpino MFI partner to go active in KIVA microfunds). She will use the loan to buy motor parts to improve their services and business. 

CEVI is helping her sustain and grow her business. It not only provides loans to its clients, but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for  her Auto Repair Shop.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun K. is married with two teenage children who are students still living at home. Her husband is a local rice farmer.

Mrs. K. has been raising pigs since 1999. She uses a small pigpen and sells her pigs for slaughter after three months when they are matured. She is applying for a loan to buy additional food to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: To buy additional food to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 55 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Marie Therese Yacine

texts.fr: marie therese est une jeune femme née en 1976 à dakar et habite au quartier mbour 1 à thies ;elle est divorcée et est mère d'un enfant qui est à sa charge ;pour gérer le quotidien ,elle fait du commerce de parfums et d'encens ,avec le pret qu'elle demande ,elle veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Marie Therese is a young woman who was born in 1976 in Dakar and lives in the Mbour district in Thies. She is divorced and the mother of one child who is in her care. To manage in life from day to day, she does commerce in perfumes and incense. With this loan she's requesting, she wants to boost her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell perfume

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
FELIPA H. P.
Es la Presidenta D. la Alcom las Violetas, vive en el  AA. HH Villa Violeta MZ H LT 20 distrito D. Comas – Lima, tiene 56 años, es separada D. su esposo, tiene 4 hijos que son independientes, tiene una  nietecita D. 3 añitos D. edad que esta bajo su responsabilidad, es quien le da fuerzas para seguir adelante dice Felipa,  tiene una bodega en su domicilio que ya esta funcionando hace 4 años que poco a poco con los prestamos que  ha ido incrementando en EDAPROSPO ha   mejorado en lo económico y personal, el dinero desembolsado S/ 1,000.00 lo invertirá para surtir su bodega y con lo que le sobra seguirá haciendo mejoras en su casa.
 
La Alcom las Violetas esta conformada por 10 integrantes esta en el III ciclo, ha desembolsado el monto D. s/ 8,400.00, cada socio se dedica a las diferentes actividades como son vta D. CDs, jugo D. naranja, confecciones, vta D. golosinas entre otros, son clientes muy puntuales, responsables se apoyan entre ellos no permiten que caiga ninguno, se sienten identificados con EDAPROSPO porque les  ayudo a mejorar no solo en sus negocios sino también en cuanto a lo económico y personal.  

La  meta D. la Sra. Felipa es reabrir su  Internet que lo cerró por problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Felipa H. P. is President of the Alcom la Violetas, and lives in the district of Comas, in Lima, Peru. She is 56 years old, separated from her husband, and has four independent children. She is responsible for caring for her three year old neice, which she she says provides her with the strength necessary to move forward. For the last four years she has operated a store from her home and, little by little, and with the help of loans from EDAPROSPO, she has improved both her economic and personal status. She will invest the majority of the loan of S/ 1,000.00 [approximately US $340] to further supply her store and, with any leftover money, will improve her home. The Alcom las Violetas is comprised of 10 members, is in its third cycle, and has until now spent a total amount of S/ 8,400.00. Each member is dedicated to a different activity such as the sale of CDs, orange juice and candy, among others. They are very punctual and responsible clients that help each other out and do not allow any individual member to fail. They reached out to EDAPROSPO because the organization supports them not only in improving negotiations but also to improve economic and personal issues. Ms Felipa's goal is to have Internet access again, which was shut down due to economic difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa en sus actividades como madre y comerciante. Desde que se separó de su pareja se dedicó a atender a sus dos hijos, quienes son ya jóvenes, y junto a ellos vive en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Elena siempre tuvo en interés de tener un negocio propio y para lograrlo tuvo que trabajar como comerciante ambulante por muchos años, con el paso del tiempo logró ahorrar y pudo instalar una tienda de abarrotes dentro de su casa, para la cual, también sus hijos mayores le ayudaron con el capital necesario para algunos productos. Ahora viene trabajando desde las 6 de la tarde hasta la media noche, pues la demanda en su zona es mayor por las noches y requiere aprovecharla para incrementar y diversificar sus productos. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 años con el apoyo de sus hijos y espera que la inversión que han hecho sea muy provechoza, pues una de sus ambiciones es ampliar su local e instalar un bazar donde pueda contar con la variedad de productos que solicitan sus clientes. Este es su octavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y gracias al banco comunal que integra logró potencias sus aptitudes sociales, ya que el trabajo dentro de su grupo demanda mucha integración entre los miembros. Los 2000 soles que viene solicitando los invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y algunos productos nuevos que desea implementar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking woman who takes her jobs as mother and businesswoman very seriously. After she separated from her husband, she dedicated herself to taking care of her two children who were young at the time. They live together in a house that took much effort to build. Elena always had an interest in having her own business and so she worked as a traveling saleslady for several years. Over time, she saved enough money to buy some products to open a grocery store from her home. The children help with the business.

She works from 6pm to midnight, since demand in her area is greater at night. Her business has to be well-stocked with a diversified line of products. The grocery has been in operation for 5 years, thanks to the support of the children. Elena hopes the investment she has made is worthwhile, because she has ambitions of expanding her shop and opening a bazaar where one can find a variety of products frequently requested by her customers.

This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she thanks her communal bank group for utilizing the power of its social network and demanding cooperation among the members. Her loan of 2000 soles will be used to buy groceries and other new products that she would like to introduce into her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Buligo United Nabatazi Shifa Group

texts.en: N. Shifa is thirty-years old, married with two children, of whom one child is schooling. She has been selling soft drinks for one year so far. She is using the loan to purchase a variety of fresh fruit for making juice and soft drinks such as water, sodas, passion fruit juice, Splash, Safi, and so forth for sale. She is a hard-working lady whose future hope is to work very hard to purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fresh fruit for making juice, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio R. Laínez tiene 63 años. Es un hombre que siempre ha trabajado. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer los servicios de vigilante, pero este trabajo era muy peligroso y tenía que cuidar a sus 5 hijos y al tener la necesidad de proveerle a su familia el alimento diario, continúo con este trabajo hasta que por medio de un amigo logra aprender la carpintería. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de madera, alcohol, tinte y ciertas herramientas. Su mayor sueño es adquirir su propio medio de transporte para sus productos.
texts.en:
Cecilio R. Laínez is 63 years old. He is a man that has always worked. He offers carpentry services. For over 15 years he has dedicated himself to this work. Previously he worked as a security guard, but this work was very dangerous; because he had to take care of 5 children and had to provide his family food daily, he continued in this work until, through a friend, he learned carpentry. The loan that he requests will be used as work capital to purchase wood, alcohol, dye, and certain tools. His biggest dream is to acquire his own means of transportation for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase wood, alcohol, dye, and certain tools).

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.es:
Laxmi es una madre de 20 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, todos viven en su casa propia. Hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de combustible; tales como petróleo, gasolina y kerosén. Su negocio es reconocido por vender combustible sin ser adulterado, por ello reúne diariamente hasta 280 soles de ganancia. Para abastecerse Laxmi viaja cada tres días a la localidad donde se ubica el grifo que le provee dicho combustible a menor precio y de ese modo ella puede venderlo a un precio módico, por lo que todos sus clientes la prefieren. Laxmi se siente muy contenta con su negocio, aun más porque su esposo acondicionó los cilindros de combustible en un lugar apropiado para que ella no cargue mucho peso, así como para evitar la contaminación de sus hijos.
Anteriormente sus préstamos eran a nombre de su esposo, pero ella asistía a todas las reuniones del banco comunal, en vista de ello decidieron cambiar la titularidad de crédito, pues Laxmi se siente muy compenetrada con el grupo. Además es la tesorera y se encarga mensualmente de realizar las cobranzas. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de cilindros y más combustible.
texts.en:
Laxmi is 20 years old, married and mother of 2 children, and the whole family lives her own house. For the past 2 years she has dedicated her professional career to the sale of fuel like petroleum, gasoline, and kerosene. Her business is known for selling unadulterated fuel, and for this she earns about 280 Soles per day in profits. For supplies, Laxmi travels every three days to the location where the tap is located that provides said fuel at the lowest price, and in this way she is able to sell it at a modest price. Because of this all of her clients prefer doing business with her. Laxmi is very content with her business, and even more because her husband primes the cylinders for the fuel in an appropriate location so that she does not have to bear so much weight and so that she does not contaminate her children. In the past her loans were under her husband's name, but she attended all of the meetings of the community bank and because of this decided to change the ownership of the loan and Laxmi feels very much a part of the group. Futhermore, she is the treasurer and she is in charge of the monthly collections. The money that she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of cylinders and more fuel.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her commodities and purchasing cylinders

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 27 years old. He and his wife, Emily, have a three-year-old baby. Justus is the breadwinner of the family and he has been repairing electronics in Naivasha town for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his first loan. He is planning to buy new tools to replace his old, worn out ones.  

In the future, Justus plans to have a big electronics repair shop, where he will also sell electronics like TV sets and radios.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
She's a dedicated and hardworking mother who strives hard just to provide for the needs of her family. Her name is Cirila G.. She lives in Yulo’s Park, Brgy 14, Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She is 53 years old and is married to Rogelio G. who helps her in running their business. The couple is blessed with three adult children and some of them have their own families already.  Cirila is happy to have three grandchildren.

Because she had the knowledge and skills to make “Bibingka”, a native Ilonggo delicacy that is made with rice flour, coconut milk, sugar and young coconut strips cooked in a top-fired oven, she started this business in 1996 with the help of her husband. They set up a cart with a specially made "bibingka" oven that enabled them to make and sell hot "bibingka" in different places that have high foot traffic. On Sundays, they setup their mobile "bibingka" bakery in front of the cathedral where Sunday mass goers could buy their product when they come out of the church after attending mass. On weekdays, they setup in front of schools with high student population. 

In 2005, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to gain access to additional capital for her business. Because of the additional capital, she was able to improve her business income so that on the 3rd cycle, she decided to invest her loan not on her "bibingka" business but instead invest it in a backyard pig-fattening venture. This gave her a good return on her business after three to four months when she sold the pigs, enabling her to increase her income even further. The two ventures give her a combined average income of PHP 3,000 per week, which pays for their household expenses and school expenses, with some left over for savings.

Cirila is happy that her husband and children also help out in her business. For one week this October, they have setup their mobile store at the Bacolod Public Plaza because of the high pedestrian traffic in the area when Bacolod City celebrates its weeklong "Masskara" Festival. Cirila's "Bibingka" has gathered many regular customers and she has started receiving advance orders.

For her previous loan, she borrowed Php 27,000, which she used as additional capital for her business and it was fully paid on time and in full within her loan term. Now she is borrowing for her 12th cycle, a loan of Php 29,500 to be used as additional working capital for her business. The income from it will be be used to improve the living conditions of her family and some will be set aside as savings for future emergencies.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Maritza Arely

texts.es: Maritza Arely D. reside en el occidente del país en el departamento de Morazán. Con 47 años de edad Maritza es madre soltera de sus dos hijo de 22 y 21 años de edad.  Maritza ha sacado adelante a sus hijos por medio de las ganancias generadas por su negocio. Desde hace muchos años Maritza se dedica a la producción de comida, tras ver la necesidad de este tipo de negocio en su zona, fue  así como se animo emprender su comedor, de comida a la vista, ahora ella solicita de un crédito para aumentar la producción de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Maritza Arely D. lives in the western part of El Salvador in the department of Morazán. She is a 47-year-old single mother of two children, ages 22 and 21. Maritza has made headway with her children thanks to the profits she makes from her business. For many years she has made a living making food. After seeing a need for this type of business in her area, she was encouraged to start a diner, and now she is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients so she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to be able to make more meals

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta G. est une dame de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de poissons séchés, fumés et de divers autres condiments. Ces revenus lui permettent de subvenir aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille
texts.en:
Anta G. is a 56-year-old lady who is married and the mother of seven children.  She has a business involving dried and smoked fish and also a variety of other condiments.  These revenues enable her to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do business in fish and various other food items

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 40 years old and married with three school-age children. She runs a grocery business in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She sells onions, tomatoes, and potatoes and employs one other person. Felister has been in business for eight years and has successfully completed a previous loan for Kes. 40,000. She requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 80,000 to expand her business by cereals to her inventory. 

She describes herself as hardworking and says that her dream for the future is to be self-dependent and supply her goods from her own shamba (farm).

loans.use: Add stock of cereals

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.en:
Teresa is 26 years old and is married. She and her husband do not yet have children. 

Teresa raises pigs and sells pork. She will use her loan to buy pigs that she will raise and then sell for their meat. Teresa sells pork and "nacatamales" (corn cakes filled with vegetables and meat and steamed in banana leaves), the traditional Nicaraguan weekend meal, on foot. She started this business ten years ago when she needed a way to earn an income. 

Teresa says that this business has provided a good income, and the loans that she has received from Fundación León 2000 have helped to stabilize her household. Maria’s mother is in poor health and, as a result of all the years that she has had this business, she has problems with arthritis.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Crecer Con Libertad Group

texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Crecer con Libertad" (Grow with Freedom) and has 18 members, all hardworking men and women of various ages.  They work in different trades; for example, some make and sell artisanal goods made of wire, stones, and cloth, among other materials.  Other borrowers make handicrafts or work in repairing broken household items, dressmaking, and weaving.  Some borrowers work in sales, selling food, clothing, and maintaining their grocery shops.
 
This group's objective is to grow in their respective businesses and reach their goals, while promoting their quality products.  Above all, they want to grow their businesses to create more economic stability for their families, continuing to develop and grow better with each day.

Jocelyn is the secretary of the group (in the photo, she is the pregnant woman on the far right).  She is an artisan who makes necklaces, rings, hoop earrings, and bracelets using several different materials.  She works with beads, stones, wood, and cloth, among others.  Jocelyn often travels to Santiago, Chile’s capital city, to purchase these materials.  She sells the products from her home, in markets, and in other well-populated areas.  She will use this loan to purchase more materials for her artisan work in order to expand the diversity of her products.

The experience that they have had with Fondo Esperanza, according to Jocelyn, has surpassed the group's expectations.
