texts.en: Uktam S.  is 61 years old and is married with 4 adult children. His wife helps him in the canteen that he has owned and operated for the past 10 years. Hujamurod cooks his tasty dishes for the people of Penjikent everyday.The canteen is located in the center of the city which allows him access to many customers. With the help of a loan, Uktam would like to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: G. S Belen Group

texts.es:
Evelyn  cristela Alemán L. tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, esta joven tiene 2 hijos de los cuales tienen las siguientes edades una niña de 13 años  que cursa el primer año de secundaria, un varón de 9 años que cursa el tercer grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como obrero, los propósitos de Evelyn son de tener su propia casa y en sus propósitos seguir aportando ingresos para sus hijos para que así tengan un futuro en sus estudios y cuando tenga realizado su deseo de tener su propia casa darle las respectivas  mejoras a su vivienda y dejarle a sus hijos un lugar adecuado para vivir.

Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas, el tiempo que tiene en este negocio es de 20 años la ubicación del negocio es en el mercado central, ella inicia su negocio por una amiga pero las intenciones de trabajo las mantuvo siempre, por lo que decide llevar a vender su producto hasta el mercado central y así como obtiene este medio de trabajo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita la compra de materia prima como es el maíz y la leña para obtener mas producción y con la ayuda de su amiga María Cristina quien le brindo el apoyo para que juntas conformaran este financiamiento.

Su nombre es María Cristina V. D., tiene la edad de 35 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña María tiene 5 hijos sus edades son las siguientes una niña de la edad de 19 años que cursa que cursa el 1 año de la carrera técnica 	quirúrgica, su otra hija tiene la edad de 17 años que cursa el 5 año de secundaria y un varón  de 14 años que cursa el 1 año de secundaria y su otra hija que tiene 17 años y cursa el 3 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como obrero, en sus deseos esta el construir una vivienda por lo que ella tiene el lugar pero no tiene el suficiente dinero para la construcción de esta y en sus propósitos esta encaminar a todos sus hijos para que estos tengan un provechosos porvenir.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de tortillas, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado central, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 12 años, ella inicia este negocio por su amiga que se llama Evelyn Cristela  quien es la que le da el apoyo para que esta establezca su negocio y logra vender en el mercado, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de los materiales para la elaboración de sus productos y agradece tanto a su amiga Evelyn como a Fundación León 2000 y alas organizaciones correspondientes por este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Evelyn Cristela A. L. is 31 years old and she is married and has two children: one girl aged 13 years and going to grade 7, and a boy aged 9 and going to grade 3. Her life partner is a laborer. Evelyn's goal is to have her own home and to keep earning an income for her children so that they have a future in their studies. And when she does have her own home she wants to make renovations to it so that she can give her children an adequate place to live.

Her business is selling tortillas. She has been running this business for the past 20 years, selling in the central market. She started her business for a friend but she just kept going afterwards. She takes her products all the way to the central market and this is the work she carries out. The loan she requests is destined as working capital because she needs to purchase items such as corn and firewood to be able to increase her production. With the help of her friend Maria Cristina who provided her with so much support, together they will responsible for this financing.

Her name is María Cristina V. D. and she is 35 years old and has a boyfriend. Maria has 5 chidren: one girl aged 19 and she is doing her first year of a surgery technician program, another girl aged 17 and she is in grade 11, and a boy who is 14 and is going to grade 7. She has another daughter aged 17 and going to grade 9 and is married. Her life partner is a laborer. Maria's dream is to build a home. She has a plot of land but she does not have enough money to build and in her plan is to guide all of her children so that they have a promising future.

Her business is selling tortillas, selling them in the central market. She has been running her business for the past 12 years. She started her business thanks to her friend Evelyn Cristela, who has given her the support to establish her business. She sells in teh market and the loan is destined to finance the purchase of materials to make her products. She is so grateful to her friend Evelyn and to the Fundacion Leon 2000, and all of the related organisations for their support.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en:
Kokou E. is a 27-year-old married man. He lives in Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He does not have any children because he does not yet have the means to provide for them.

He has started a business selling cellphones and prepaid cellphone cards to improve his financial situation. Since there is no electricity in Wome, most residents have cellphones, and Kokou’s shop has been doing very well. With this loan from Kiva, Kokou hopes to buy more cellphone cards to resell and build a new display to make his shop look more professional. With the profits he will earn from his business, Kokou can better provide for his wife and save money for his future family.

loans.use: Buy more cellphones and cellphone cards to resell

loans.name: Matuafetalai

texts.en: Matuafetalai T. L., 36, is married and has four children.  She has many years experience selling various stock items to the villagers and general public seven days per week. Matuafetalai has had two previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  She plans to purchase items to restock her shop.

loans.use: Purchase items to re-stock shop

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, sector Nueva Alianza, de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de 36 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, es casada y posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace año medio con el MMR y se presto S/. 500.00 nuevos soles ella se dedica a comprar y vender de ganado para engordar y su venta lo hace en las ferias ganaderas, ella invirtió en la alimentación de su ganado.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 que pagara en 3 cuotas, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas  (cebada, alfalfa), alimento (afrecho, concentrado, etc.) para asegurar una buena alimentación del ganado y obtener con un buen peso y a su vez obtener buenas ganancias. Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por su confianza, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a member of the "Sacuyo" communal bank, in the Nueva Alianza section of the town of Sacuyo, district of Acora, province and department of Puno. She is 36 years old, has three children, is married and completed her primary school education. She has worked with MMR for a half year and was loaned S/. 500 new soles which she invested in feed for her livestock. She buys and sells livestock which she fattens up and sells in the markets. With this loan for S/. 500, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will invest in purchasing seeds (barley, alfalfa), feed (brans, feed mix, etc.) to insure that her livestock are well-fed and reach a good weight so that she can make a good profit. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their trust which has allowed her to improve her family´s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and food for livestock.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet K. is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: a boy and three daughters. The first three of her children are already in school; the last born is yet to start. She lives with her husband and children in a family house at a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers away from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

Janet’s husband is a farmer who cultivates palm nuts. She is a bread baker. Janet buys bags of flour and other ingredients from wholesalers in the nearby markets. She bakes bread in a traditional oven made from clay. Janet says she supplies to beverage sellers and retailers in her community. Janet has been in business for four years. It has been her desire to expand her business so she can make enough savings to help her husband take very good care of the family. She wants a loan to procure bags of flour in bulk so she can supply bread to more customers.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge C. es tecnico en laboratorio y hace 1 1/2 año que inicio con su laboratorio clinico en donde realiza todo tipo de examenes de sangre, eses y orina.
El Sr, Jorge ha sabido ganar su clientela por la atencion que les brinda y tambien porque el laboratorio esta ubicado en un lugar cerca de varias clinicas medicas, entonces muchos de los medicos mandan a su laboratorio los clientes para que se hagan los examenes que necesitan. ademas que es el unico laboratorio clinico en esta parte de la comunidad.
El es soltero y de el depende su madre y dos sobirnas a las cuales el les brinda todo, alimentacion, salud, estudios, ropa etc.
el esta muy feliz ya que una de sus sobrinas esta en el colegio y es muy buena estudiante. el dice que ellas son los ojos de su vida.
texts.en:
Jorge C. is a laboratory technician. A year and a half ago, he started his own laboratory clinic where he provides every type of exam for blood, feces and urine. Jorge won his clients through the attention he provides them and the laboratory's location. His business is located near many medical clinics and many doctors send their patients to his lab to take necessary exams. His lab is the only one in that part of the community.

Jorge is single and takes care of his mother and two nieces. He provides them with everything: food, healthcare, schooling, clothing, etc.

He is very happy now that one his nieces is in high school and is a good student. He says that his nieces are the ojos de su vida or “apples of his eye.”

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy reagents for exams (glucose, pregnancy, etc.)

loans.name: Evelin Brigida

texts.es: La Sra. Evelin es madre soltera tiene un hijo en edad escolar,  atiende un  Restaurante de comida; su especialidad es la comida chuquisaqueña, departamento de Bolivia, con muchos años de trayectoria es muy conocida en la Zona, con la ayuda de la mama y la hermana, viven en una pequeña casa que comparte con sus mama  es con el único ingreso con que cuentan para solventar todos  sus gastos familiares, y de estudios de su hijo, es cumplida con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Evelin is a single mother. She has a school-age son. She works at a restaurant. Her specialty is chuquisaqueña (local) cuisine from Bolivia. With many years in this career and the help of her mother and sister, she is well known in the area. She lives in a small house that she shares with her mother. She pays all the family costs, including the education of her son, with her income.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of dishes, pots and a food processor

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
La señora Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 01 hijo, ella posee estudios de superior completa (secretariado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace pocos años, ella posee un negocio de radio comunicaciones y giros a distancia, ella desea prestarse préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir algunos materiales para su tienda, ya que también viene iniciando un negocio de venta de productos, su deseo es tener una tienda mucho mas grande.
texts.en:
Yobana C. Apana is a member of the Communal Bank "Women Working for Development ," of the Cabanilla district, in the Lampa province, department of Puno. She is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a son. She completed secondary school. She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for only a few years. She owns a radio communications business and she is requesting a loan of 500 soles ($175). She is committed to repaying the loan in 6 installments. With the loan she will acquire some materials for her store because she is also initiating the sale of products and her desire is to have a much larger store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun S., 30, has been selling types of desserts in the village for years. In this business, she generates an income of $5 per day and uses her income to manage the family’s daily expenses. As another source of the family's income, her husband drives a trailer-motor (tuk tuk). The family now lives with their two single children, who are students.

Recently, Mrs. S.’s husband has been feeling bored with his tuk-tuk as it is too old and is frequently broken, so his clients are decreasing. To solve the problem, Mrs. S. would like a loan in order to buy a new one to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to replace a broken one

loans.name: Kiganda Central Kiza Jolly Group

texts.en: K. Jolly is a 43-year-old single mother of six children. Three of her children are schooling and she has two other dependents who are also in school. She has been operating her business of selling bananas for more than 10 years. She is using the loan to purchase bananas on a wholesale basis to add stock to her business. She loads a full truck and sells in the market. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to build a permanent house.

loans.use: To purchase bananas in wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more raw materials to make more bites.

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es: Cristina Isabel M. M. de 35 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Paz junto a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad. Ella posee un negocio en la playa el Cuco en el cual vende agua, refrescos, agua de coco, flotadores y collares y pulseras artesanales las cuales ella misma las hace junto a sus hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más productos para su negocio como golosinas y más flotadores, así también desea comprar materia prima para la elaboración de collares y pulseras. Cristina es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual ha salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Cristina Isabel M. M. is 35 years old and lives in the department of La Paz with her 4 dependent children. She has her own business on El Cuco beach in which she sells water, soft drinks, coconut water, inflatable floating devices, and necklaces and bracelets that she and her children make. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more products, such as candy and more floaties. She would also like to purchase materials to make necklaces and bracelets. Cristina is a very hardworking woman who has gotten ahead thanks to her own efforts and her desire for self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make necklaces

loans.name: Agyenkwa Group

texts.en:
Mary is 45 and is married with seven children, all of whom are in school. Mary started her fish business thirteen years ago.  Many people buy from her in the market place in her town. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty fish and for that reason she is a favorite of many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She wants a loan to buy increased stocks of assorted fresh fishes, in order to have increased sales and income to support her children's education and her business growth. In the photograph she is the one sitting second from the right, in the brown dress. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Agyenkwa’, which literally means Saviour. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They request the loan to upgrade their business to increase sales. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and for peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk fish

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 Nanyoga Nalongo Group

texts.en: Nalongo Nalongo is 50 years old. She is blessed with ten children, six of whom are going to school, and she takes care of eight siblings who are also going to school. She is utilizing the loan to purchase clothing. Also, she is a tailor and after sewing or making clothes, she puts them out for sale. Her business is improving and she is happy that she is surviving. She is an encouraging and hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say S. is married and has two young children. He lives with his wife and children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, he works in construction, and he operates a business as motor-taxi driver in his free time from work in the evening, earning collectively an income of US $7 per day. His wife is employed as a worker in a local garment factory, earning an income of US $2 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a new motorbike for his business as motor-taxi driver. By doing so, he hopes he will be able to raise the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: motorbike purchase

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Ayda es comerciante de víveres que da al crédito, azucar, harina, aroz y aceite, tiene dos hijos, uno de 4 años y otro de seis meses, su esposo es policía y actualmente está trabajando en el interior del país (ciudad de Santa Cruz); estas dos actividades son sus fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ellos; vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona de Río Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (azúcar, arroz y otros) y así poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Ayda.

loans.use: compra de azucar, arroz y otros al por mayor para su posterior venta al crédito.

loans.name: Marbell Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidario Marbell está formado por Ada Francis B. Jiménez, Martha Cedemia C. L. y Jessenia del Socorro J. C., provenientes de Masaya, del barrio llamado Monimbo. 

La coordinadora del grupo es Ada de 24 años de edad, quien posee una pulpería bastante surtida en su casa, esto desde hace mas de 2 años, que se motivó a hacerlo debido a que hay un colegio cerca de sucasa y los niños mucho buscan golosinas.

Así inició la venta de frutas, golosinas y actualmente ha logrado surtir el  negocio mucho más. Su meta es logra invertir en productos de uso higiénico como papel higiénico, jabones de baño, perfumes, etc.

Martha C. vende artesanías de madera, cerámicas y hamacas y Jessenia J. vende ropa de manera ambulante en el mercado de Managua.
texts.en:
The Marbell Solidarity Group is comprised of Ada Francis B. Jiménez, Martha Cedemia C. L., and Jessenia del Socorro J. C.. They are from Masaya and live in the neighborhood of Monimbo.

Ada is 24 years old and the group coordinator. For two years, she has operated a grocery store out of her home that is adequately stocked. Her house is located near a school, so she was motivated to start her business because the children are always looking to buy candy. In addition to sweets, she also sells fruit and is looking to add more products to her inventory. Her goal is to acquire hygiene products such as toilet paper, bath soaps, perfumes, etc.

Martha C. sells wooden handicrafts, ceramics, and hammocks. Jessenia J. sells clothing as a traveling merchant at the market in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional products to restock their businesses

loans.name: Cristalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo cristalina está integrado por Hidalya del Socorro S. V. de 29 años, Yadirco del Socorro A. de 29 años y Ramón Francisco B. A. de 27 años. Ellos son originarios de San Pedro.

S. es la coordinadora del grupo ella inicio hace tres años vendiendo pan y fresco en su casa actualmente tiene una pequeña pulpería bien surtida. Mientras A. vende verduras y B. vende granos básicos.

Ellos necesitan el crédito para incrementar su negocios respectivamente y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Cristalina" are Hidalya del Socorro S. V., 29 years old, Yadirco del Socorro A., 29 years old, and Ramón Francisco B. A., 27 years old. There are from San Pedro.

S. is the coordinator of the group. She started three years ago selling bread and pops at home. Presently she has a small well-supplied general store. A. sells vegetables and B. sells basic grains.

They need the loan to increase their respective businesses and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, dairy and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of  Motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis is forty-three years old. She is married with five children. She is really resourceful and supportive of her husband in financing their children’s education to provide them with better opportunities in the future. At the moment, two of her children have completed senior high and are waiting to enter the university. She is a food vendor and sells cooked yam and rice with stew. She sells at the market square in her locality. She wants to use the loan to buy raw materials such as yam tubers, rice, vegetables, and cooking oil. She believes this will help her to reduce costs and save more, enabling her to provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 44 years old and married. Speciose and her husband take care of 3 dependents aged 9,12, and 20. Speciose and her family live in the northern province of Rwanda, in a place called Nyarugenge, which is approximately 3 hours' drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here, Speciose has had her own butcher shop for the past four years. The demands of her business require that she work from 6 AM to 7 PM every day except Sunday.

This is Speciose's second loan; she paid back her first loan in full and on time. Her business has been a bit slow recently and her working capital is strained. Speciose believes that if she gets her second loan, she will be able to supply sufficient meat and meat products to her customers and purchase needed supplies. Any profits that Speciose earns from the products that she purchases with this loan she will reinvest in her business to strengthen her balance sheet.

loans.use: Purchase more meat and supplies for sale

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es una socia muy trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 46 años, es separada y madre de dos hijos mayores de edad.
Elisa se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza, actividad que viene realizando hace cuatro años y que gracias al prèstamo que le da el Movimiento Manuela Ramos sus ventas han aumentado, pues trabaja dando crédito y cobrando diariamente. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace seis años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de productos de belleza.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà prendas de vestir y juguetes que serán vendidos a sus clientes. 
La meta de Elisa es llegar a tener una boutique y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elisa is a very hard-working and dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 46, separated, and has two grown children. She sells beauty products. She has been doing this for four years. Thanks to the loan she received from the Manuela Ramos Movement, her sales have increased. She works giving credit, and she charges daily. She has been part of the Las Tigresas Communal Bank for six years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought beauty products. She currently needs a loan for 3,000 PEN, which she will use to buy articles of clothing and toys to sell to her customers. Elisa’s goal is to have a boutique and to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy articles of clothing and toys for children

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes C. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de pasteles de queso.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas material para la elaboración, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito y así comprar el material que necesita para la elaboración de los pasteles que tiene por entregar.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia ya que tiene poco que se quedo viuda.
texts.en:
Señora María Lourdes C. has already worked for more than two years making and selling cheesecake. She needs more items for her business, but right now she doesn’t have any money to invest. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs for the cheesecakes that she has to deliver to her customers. The business is the sole source of income for her family. They don't have very much as María is a widow.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making cheesecake

loans.name: Eltaf Group

texts.en:
The Eltaf group has three male members. These three members want to progress in their business and bring some changes to it.
They requested a group loan of 30.000 Afghani.
Zabiullah is the group leader. He has a shop where he sells clothes and cosmetics. With the loan he receives, he would like to purchase more good quality materials and clothes for his shop. 
The second member is Mirwais who has a tailoring business. With his loan, he will buy a sewing machine and other required materials for his shop.
The last member is Farhed who has a tire repair shop. He needs some tools for his shop, so with the loan he can solve his problem.
They would like to say that Kiva is an effective process that can support the entrepreneurs to start a business and sustain it as well.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his shop

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng V., age 31, is a vegetable seller. She has been engaged in this business for years, and is earning approximately $2 each day. She has a partner in her husband, who is a goldsmith and sells jewelry in the local market. The couple have three school-aged children who are dependent on the profit they earn in their businesses. Sreng V. saw that selling jewelry is a profitable business which provided her family with needed income. So, she would like to increase this business by requesting a loan through HKL. She will buy more supplies of jewelry for her husband to sell.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of jewelry for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Giovanna Carmen

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Giovanna, pertenece al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestra socia está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 35 años de edad y ella tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad, nuestra socia es casada y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ella  tiene su stand en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, otros productos), la socia ayuda económicamente a la crianza de sus hijos y a a la alimentación de la familia, nuestra socia desea que su negocio prospere y que la calidad de vida de su hogar sea cada vez mejor.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member, Giovanna, belongs to the NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA community bank. She lives in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas, Urubamba, about an hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco. Giovanna is 35 years old, married and has 2 children, 15- and 10-years old. She spends part of her day running the family home and part of her day operating her retail business, a small grocery. She has a stand in Urubamba's model market. Our member needs the loan to buy merchadise (rice, sugar, pasta, milk, etc.) that she will resell to her customers. Her income goes to raising her children and feeding her family. Her greatest hopes are that her business prospers and that she can improve her family's quality of life. Giovanna is grateful for the opportunities that micro-lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan M., 29, is making sure that her family has enough to cover their daily needs. Married to Joseph M. who works at a printing press, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn their living so that their family can have a better life.  She has managed her own variety store for several years.

Joan has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows in buying added stock for her business.   Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 8,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added working capital for her expanding business by buying more stock for her store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can finance her children’s schooling until they graduate from college. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more assorted products for her store

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 33-year-old married man and father of three school-aged children. Since 1992, he has owned a car cleaning shop where he services cars from his town and its surroundings. His job involves cleaning, sewing and making car furniture. His business has become well developed over the years because he is the only provider of such service in the whole region. In addition, he is able to work on all type of cars.
Elias plans to expand and reinforce his business in the coming months, and wishes to purchase a furniture sewing machine. He has already saved some money for this, but he still needs to borrow $1,000 USD from Kiva partner, Ameen, to be able to buy it.

loans.use: To purchase a furniture sewing machine

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en:
Malyn E. is from the village of Bolihon, Taglimao Cagayan De Oro City. She is 31 years old. Malyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $270 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Malyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. Now she is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. Malyn plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bolihon, Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: S. Shahlo is 37 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. In order to help her husband support their large family, she started her own business. So, for the last five years, she has been selling curtains. Shahlo has her own trading place that is located in one of the local markets. Being by nature a very friendly and polite person, she obtained her clientele very soon. The business is stable and is generating the main income for the family. Today, Shahlo is planning to increase her working capital in order to expand her business. She needs additional funds to purchase new items of curtains to sell. For this purpose Shahlo requests 3,000 USD. Shahlo has already received a previous loan from IMON and has proved herself a reliable client. She thanks all for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan repayment. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and expand her business by purchasing more curtains to sell

loans.name: Đào's Group

texts.en:
V. A. Đào Thị (20201010003) is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  V. A. is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngân Cầu nhóm 01 (1).


V. A. is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, V. A. is employed in a business that provides general services to local community members.  V. A. has been engaged in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately $280 a month from these activities.


In 2009, V. A. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  V. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20201010002) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing recycling services.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20201010013) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  Trần Thị L. (20201010012) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


V. A. Đào Thị (20201010003) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  V. A. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngân Cầu nhóm 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doA. chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  V. A. thực hiện công việc kinh doA. này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, V. A. kiếm được khoảng 5.200.0000 VND.  Vào 2009, V. A. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy.  V. A. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doA..  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20201010002) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


2.  Trương Thị L. (20201010013) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là kinh doA. cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  Trần Thị L. (20201010012) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là kinh doA. cửa hàng T.t.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ronaliza

texts.en: Ronaliza C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Ronaliza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ronaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ronaliza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 6 hijos que están estudiando y su mayor sueño es educar a sus hijos, Maruja es conviviente. Maruja pertenece al Banco Comunal Brisa y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fáciles y aprendió a ser puntual.
Maruja es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos y están estudiando, Maruja viaja a la ciudad de Ica en donde vende cereales, panes, productos que compra en el mercado de abastos, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes haciendas de la zona. Además Maruja tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras y carnes. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Maruja has 6 children that are students and her dream is to educate her children. Maruja lives with her partner. She also belongs to the Brisa Communal Bank and what she like most are the easy loans from which she has learned to be punctual. Maruja travels to the city of Ica where she sells grains, bread and products that she buys at the fresh food markets. She sells her goods at the various farms in the region. In addition, Maruja has a store in her house where she sells groceries, mostly vegetables and meats. She will use her loan to buy rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maruja will use the loan to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Seidou

texts.en:
Monsieur Seidou A. is a chauffeur who also owns a general store. He is 37 years old and married to a woman who also works as a merchant. They have four children. 

To make extra money to help feed his family, Msr. A. runs this general store. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs to increase his store's stock. He's had the store since 2003, but this is his first time taking a loan from WAGES, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To reinforce his commercial activities and purchase items to sell in his general store

loans.name: Irene Clare

texts.en:
Irene Clare Achieng is a businesswoman who sells clothes (kitenge). She buys her stock in Busia twice a month and sells in Nairobi. Basically, she started this business to subsidize her previous investment in farming which could not fulfill her family's needs effectively.

Irene is 28 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She tells how harsh the economy is and calls for aggressiveness. She tells how lucrative the business is, but mentions inadequate capital as a great setback for diversification. 

Her reason for joining the KIVA loan initiative was so that she could access a loan worth 10,000 KES so that she can expand her business to generate more income, which will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Increase her stock and expand the business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George T. is an individual client of Pearl Microfinance from Rukungiri. He is 52 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are still in school. George is in the business of agriculture and has banana plantations. However, as another source of income, he sells coffee, beans, sweet potatoes and cassava that he buys from other farmers and takes to the market. 

George needs a loan to be able to buy manure, mulch and stake poles for his plantations so that they give him better produce. He has been in the farming business for 15 years and he inherited it from his late father. It is because of his hard work that he is where he is right now. 

His plan is to expand his agriculture business and build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: Buying manure, mulch and stake poles for his plantations so that they give him better produce

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. is from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Lilia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili G. is currently in the business of selling cabbages, beans, fish and sweet potatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish, beans and some bags of maize flour to sell.  Lili is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more fish, beans and some bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa L. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 63 years old and is married with two adult children. Rosa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over forty years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: G.s. Paso De Dios Group

texts.es: La señora Martina tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 12 años respectivamente. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y peluches, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante y en el mercado de Jinotepe. Ella ya tiene ocho años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual nació como una necesidad de obtener un ingreso por la falta de empleo que aqueja a nuestro país. Ella solicita este préstamo con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de más ropa, a ser distribuido entre sus clientes ya establecidos. Otra integrante del grupo es doña Marbelly, la cual tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y habita en el Rosario. Su esposo trabaja como vendedor. Ella además tiene 2 hijos de cuatro y seis años respectivamente. La señora se dedica a la venta de verduras, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante en una bicicleta. Ya la señora tiene 13 años dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual empezó por la falta de empleo y buscando una manera de brindar la alimentación a sus hijos. Ella solicita este préstamo con el propósito de comprar verduras y golosinas, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas para ganar más. Su sueño es comprar un tramo en el mercado nuevo de Jinotepe para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Señora Martina is 34 years old, married and has 2 children, ages 9 and 12.  She sells used clothing and stuffed animals in the Jinotepe market in an itinerant manner.  She has been doing this for eight years.  She started this business because she needed to have an income and the unemployment is rampant in our country.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more clothing to distribute to her established customers.  

Another member of the group is Doña Marbelly who is 28 years old, married and lives in El Rosario.  Her husband works as a salesperson.  They also have 2 children, ages 4 and 6 months.  Doña Marbelly travels on her bicycle selling vegetables.  She has been doing this for 13 years and started because she was unemployed and looking for a way to feed her children.   She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and candy to increase her sales and her income.  Her dream is to be able to buy a spot in the new market in Jinotepe to sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing, vegetables and candy

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May B. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba. She is 36 years old and married. She and her husband do not have any children. To make a living, May owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. May B. has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, May joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. May is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients to make her products.
  
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week.  She sells her products at the market at retail prices.     

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. Her main business challenges include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only. 

Mary lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anita;   la socia tiene 33 años de edad, es casada estudio solo hasta la secundaria y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la artesanía ella compra y vende artesanía, también tiene como actividad la agricultura y ella compra y vende productos agrícolas, entre los que tiene papa, maíz, verduras. La socia realiza también algunas manualidades como aretes, collares y otros para vender en el área de artesanía. La socia desea el crédito para comprar mercadería de tipo artesanal y venderla. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería artesanal.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the community bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" [The Friendship of Ollantaytambo], which is located in the Ollantaytambo district in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Anita is 33 years old, married, has two children, and went to school until high school.  She works creating and selling crafts, and also works buying and selling agricultural products like potatoes, corn, and vegetables.  She also makes earrings, necklaces, and other jewelry to sell in the craft market.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase craft products and sell them.  She is thankful for this loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase craft materials

loans.name: Elias Kiplagat

texts.en:
Elias Kiplagat K., age 23 and unmarried, is a potato farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya. He harvests his potatoes and sells them to his customers at a profit. He has been in this business for about a year now.

Elias was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of our credit officers and he has no other history with any microfinance institute. He is applying for his first loan of Kshs 20,000 with KADET Ltd, which he plans to use to plant more potatoes next season.

In future he hopes to purchase a plot as well as to build rental houses and a family house for his future family.

loans.use: To use toward planting potatoes in the coming season

loans.name: Lilia De Fátima

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Calle #2. 

La señora Lilia  es socia del Banco Comunal hace cinco años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de cumplir y los intereses son muy bajos. Ella tiene 46 años de edad está divorciada  hace varios años y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad y solo dos viven con ella, dos de sus hijas viven en España y Suiza.

Tiene  un negocio de venta de mariscos para lo cual dos veces al mes lleva sus productos a la ciudad de Quito, además tiene un comedor en el centro, donde prepara almuerzos pero la mayoría que prepara son para entregar, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 10h00 hasta las 14h00 y los sábados y domingos desde las 10h00 hasta las 20h00, también en las tardes prepara y vende empanadas y corviches con una cuñada  le ayuda en su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ingredientes para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos, como arroz, carne, pescado, etc. Sus sueños son tener un local más amplio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “Calle #2” get together every two weeks in the residential community of Nueva California, in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí which is well known for many years.

Mrs. Lilia has been a member of the community bank for five years and she likes it because the payments are reasonable and the interest rate is very low. She is 46 years old; she has been divorced for several years and she had 5 children from that relationship; all the children are adults and only two live with her. Two of her daughters live in Spain and Switzerland.

She has a business where she sells seafood, and she travels to Quito twice a month for her business. She also has an eatery in downtown where she prepares lunch but they are mostly for delivery. She works Monday through Friday from 10:00 am until 2:00 pm; on Saturdays and Sundays she works from 10:00 am until 8:00 pm. In the afternoons, she also prepares and sells empanadas (stuffed pastries) and corviches (fish wrapped with plantain dough and fried) with her sister-in-law who helps her with the business.

She will use this loan to buy ingredients used to prepare her delicious dishes (such as rice, meat, fish, etc.). Her dreams are to expand her establishment and to continue working.

loans.use: Buy rice, meat, fish, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Luna Nueva En Huiloapan Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa D. Concepción F. D., una integrante del grupo D. Luna Nueva en Huiloapan, que está ubicado en el Estado D. Veracruz en México, se logró reunir a 15 integrantes D. las 16 que son, lo cual no siempre se logra al ser grupos tan númerosos. Se ve el comal D. la señora Concepción en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta D. antojitos en la mañana y en la tarD., negocio que inició hace 15 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir más en materias primas para la venta D. antojitos. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta. Tiene 50 años estudió hasta la secundaria, es madre y tiene un total D. 3 hijas. Quiere este crédito para invertir en las materias primas para la venta D. antojitos. También espera seguir contando con el apoyo D. la empresa para seguir con el préstamo y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Concepción F. Domínguez’s house.  She’s a member of the Luna Nueva (New Moon) group in Huiloapan which is in the state of Veracruz in México.  Of the 16 group members, 15 were able to gather together which isn’t always the case in such large groups.

One can see Concepción’s griddle in the photo.  She sells fast food snacks in the morning and afternoon, a business she started 15 years ago.

She is asking for the loan to invest in ingredients for her snack preparation.

At the moment of requesting the loan she feels very happy.  She is 50 years old and studied up to secondary school.  She is a mother of three daughters.

She wants the loan to invest in ingredients to make her fast food snacks.  She also hopes to continue to have the firm’s support to continue with the loan thus improving her profits.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Vulamehlo Group

texts.en:
Gugu is 37 years old and a single mother with 4 children, between the ages of 11 and 22 years old.  She runs a retail business selling chickens and a decoration renting business for weddings in Mtubatuba, South Africa (KZN).  In the photo above, she is raising her left hand and wearing a pink skirt.

She's been selling chickens for three years and the wedding decoration rental business for six years and runs it from her home.  She also gets income from the government's child support grant.  She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through the Women's Development Businesses and KIVA to buy a tent to rent with along with her wedding decorations.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her with the future education for her children. In the future, she would like to have more tents for her wedding decoration rental business.

She adds that WDB and Kiva are very helpful for her in her business.

loans.use: To buy a tent to rent with along with her wedding decorations rental.

loans.name: Sara Lorena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Jorge de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Jorge.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sara, ella tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11y 5 años, el mayor este año empieza a estudiar en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante. Ella es oriunda de la provincia de Santo Domingo y hace ya 11 años se vino a vivir a esta linda ciudad.

Se dedica al comercio, vende carteras, zapatillas y productos de  Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, vende bajo  pedido y cobra semanalmente. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil y hay veces que le envían ropa desde los Estados Unidos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar  carteras, zapatillas, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres años y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos. sus sueños son terminar sus estudios ya que está siguiendo enfermería.
texts.en:
In the San Jorge residential area in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful place with green mountains and enchanting landscapes, is where we find the San Jorge communal bank, whose members meet every two weeks.

Here we met Mrs. Sara who is 33 years old and is in a common-law partnership and has two children ages 11 and 5.  Both children attend school.  Her partner is a saleman.  She is from the province of Santo Domingo and has been living here in this beautiful city for 11 years.

She sells billfolds, slippers and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works door-to-door every day from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She takes orders and collects payments weekly.  She buys her goods in Guayaquil and sometimes receives clothing from the United States.

She plans to use this loan to buy billfolds, slippers, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and other products.  She has been part of the communal bank for three years and she likes how quick it is to get a loan.  She dreams of finishing her nursing studies one day.

loans.use: To buy billfolds, slippers, perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, etc.

loans.name: Joy Ann

texts.en:
Joy Ann P. is from the village of Balide, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old. Joy Ann is married and has two infant-aged children. 

To make a living, Joy Ann owns and operates a store, selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, behn, sugar, rice, soft drinks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Joy Ann has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Joy Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Joy Ann is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Joy Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  Ella estudió la secundaria completa. 
Patricia se dedica es la crianza de trucha, viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con ese dinero compró comida para trucha.
Tiene cuatro jaulas donde cría 2500 unidades, cada seis  a  siete meses realiza su respectiva venta todo en su comunidad, ya que los clientes vienen desde desaguadero y lo vende al por mayor.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos sacos de alimentos balanceados para la trucha (purina y tomasino), además comprará insumos para elaborar  comida para la trucha; los insumos que emplean para elaborar son: la soya, harina de pescado, aceite de germen de trigo, entre otros, lo cual es un poco económico para los productores. 
Su sueño es seguir con la misma actividad por unos cuantos años y posteriormente cambiar a otra actividad debido a la elevación del precio de los alimentos balanceados. Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el interés generado por los ahorros.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the communal bank named "Maria Asuncion Galindo", located in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito-Juli, in the department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and she has four children. She graduated high school. 

Patricia has a trout hatchery. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for twelve years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/300 nuevos soles and she purchased feed for trout. 

She has four basins where she has 2500 units and every six to seven months she sells the entire stock to the community. Her clients come all the way from Desaguadero and she sells in wholesale. 

With this loan, amounting to S/1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase two sacks of balanced feed for trout (Purina and Tomasino brands). She will also purchase ingredients to prepare foods for trout. The ingredients she uses are soy, fish flour, wheat germ, and others. This is more economical for producers. 

Her dream is to keep up with the same business and in a few years to change to a different business type. The price of balanced feed is rising. What she most enjoys about her communal bank is the interest generated by her savings.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for trout.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa A. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, in the province of Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old, is married, and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Felipa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood, including fish such as sardines and mackerel, in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2005, Felipa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase fish and as working capital for her business.

Felipa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fish, such as milk fish and sardines, for sale. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and/or expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish, such as milk fish and sardines, for sale

loans.name: Rebecca Singit's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca S. is 55 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Naganacan within Cauayan City, a part of Isabela province on the Mindanao islands. Rebecca raises pigs to fatten and sell. Rebecca has been in business for over twenty years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP every three months. Rebecca is also the group leader of a twelve-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2011, Rebecca joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Rebecca is requesting a loan, her first from ASKI, of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 56 years old.  She is married and has 1 child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Olivia has a beverage vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 21 years.  Olivia has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

In the future, Olivia would like to open up another business to earn more income to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak A. lives in Yerevan with his wife, parents and daughter. 

Artak is engaged in advertising. He rents an office in the city. Artak’s firm offers services in advertising, event management and branding. 

Artak wants to have online advertising for his firm and develop his business. With the requested loan he plans to buy sites for his advertisement. Artak will have the opportunity to present his services to more target groups, develop his business and get more income.

loans.use: to pay for online advertising.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es un padre de familia de 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, que cuenta sólo con agua potable en el sector La Calera, la cual se encuentra a unos 10 minutos del distrito de Reque y ha 10 minutos más de la ciudad de chiclayo.   Es un  distrito que se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la  actividad agricola, ganadera y turismo.

Julian se dedica hace más de 15 años a las labores agricolas junto con sus hijos quienes le ayudan para que el trabajo sea menos pesado, en sus chacaras o tierras cultiva frijol Bayo (especie de frijol) que es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores. Una vez que cosecha sus ingresos aumentarán y podrá seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Julian  a solicitado un préstamo  de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de semilla de frijol  para sembrar en otra área de cultivo que tiene,con la finalidad de tener más productos que vender enlos distintos mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Todas esas mejoras que tiene Julian es solo para tener mejores ingresos económicos y poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Julián, 52, is a father living with his wife and children in a house of his own, that only has potable water, in La Calera which is located about 10 minutes from Reque District and 10 minutes more from the city of Chiclayo.  It’s a district that’s characterized by its residents who are involved in farming, raising livestock and tourism.

Julián has been farming his fields for over 15 years; his children help him with the less heavy chores.  He farms Frijol Bayo (a species of bean) that is a healthy, rich food used daily by the residents.  Once it’s harvested his income will increase and he will continue improving his quality of life.

Julián is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy bean seeds to plant in another area he has with the end in mind of having more products to sell in Chiclayo’s various markets.  All these improvements that Julian has are aimed at producing more income to cover family needs.

loans.use: to buy more brown bean seeds.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama, who is married to a sanitary officer and has four children, sells cooked rice which is normally served with tomato sauce, fried fish, meat and macaroni in Kwaprow, a village in Cape Coast. Ama has been selling cooked rice for three years, helping support her husband to take care of the home.

Her loan will be used to buy rice, oil, meat, fish and other ingredients to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a food joint. In the photo, Ana is seen frying some of the fish she would be using to serve with the rice.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, fish and other ingredients to cook for sale.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El sr. Ramiro esta casado tiene dos hijos pequeños, vive en su casa propia se encuentra en la zona de Pucarita, una zona muy alejada del centro de la ciudad ellos se encuentran muy felices a pesar de la distancia que se encuentra su casa,  el préstamo lo invertirán en la reparación de su casa  la fachada, piso y otras arreglos que le falta a su casa, ya que el sr. Desea brindar comodidad a su familia, u deseo del Sr. Ramiro es el ver su casita terminada y ver en un futuro ver a sus hijos profesionales, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ramiro is married and has two young children.  He lives in his own home which is located in Pucarita.  This area is a very long way from the city center.  He and his family are very happy in spite of how far away their house is.  Ramiro will invest his loan in making some repairs to his home, its exterior and the floor.  He will also carry out some other work that needs to be done so that he can make his family comfortable.

Ramiro's wish is to see his small house finished and, in the future, to see his children become professionals.  He is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his home

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, aged 40, is married to Sophia, who does farming. They are blessed with two children, aged 9 and 11 years. He is in the motorcycle transportation business, which he has been doing for one year. The business earns him a monthly income of 14,500 Kenyan shillings.

This is his second loan term with KADET LTD, and he has successfully managed to pay his previous loan. He will use the loan funds to service his motorcycle. Francis intends to buy another motorcycle using the profits he anticipates, and in the future, hopes to educate his children and have a fleet of cars for transportation.

loans.use: to service the motorbike.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, vive en la comunidad de La Estancia que  pertenece al cantón Paute, este cantón  es de clima templado propicio para el cultivo de una gran variedad de frutas y de flores, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Doña María tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 27, 20, 16 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su tercera hija estudia en el colegio y su último hijo en una escuelita del cantón. Con su sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las mismas que vende en su comunidad. Cría ganado, cuyes y gallinas y también las que vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes, ganado y  alimento de animales.

Su meta es tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
